PERSONAE.TITLE: Dramatis Personae
PERSONA: Lords, Officers, Citizens, Boy, and Attendant.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I.  An apartment in the DUKE'S palace.
STAGEDIR:
Enter DUKE VINCENTIO, ESCALUS, Lords and
Attendants

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Escalus.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: My lord.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Of government the properties to unfold,
Would seem in me to affect speech and discourse;
Since I am put to know that your own science
Exceeds, in that, the lists of all advice
My strength can give you: then no more remains,
But that to your sufficiency, as your Worth is able,
And let them work. The nature of our people,
Our city's institutions, and the terms
For common justice, you're as pregnant in
As art and practise hath enriched any
That we remember. There is our commission,
From which we would not have you warp. Call hither,
I say, bid come before us Angelo.
What figure of us think you he will bear?
For you must know, we have with special soul
Elected him our absence to supply,
Lent him our terror, dress'd him with our love,
And given his deputation all the organs
Of our own power: what think you of it?

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: If any in Vienna be of worth
To undergo such ample grace and honour,
It is Lord Angelo.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Look where he comes.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Always obedient to your grace's will,
I come to know your pleasure.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Angelo,
There is a kind of character in thy life,
That to the observer doth thy history
Fully unfold. Thyself and thy belongings
Are not thine own so proper as to waste
Thyself upon thy virtues, they on thee.
Heaven doth with us as we with torches do,
Not light them for themselves; for if our virtues
Did not go forth of us, 'twere all alike
As if we had them not. Spirits are not finely touch'd
But to fine issues, nor Nature never lends
The smallest scruple of her excellence
But, like a thrifty goddess, she determines
Herself the glory of a creditor,
Both thanks and use. But I do bend my speech
To one that can my part in him advertise;
Hold therefore, Angelo:--
In our remove be thou at full ourself;
Mortality and mercy in Vienna
Live in thy tongue and heart: old Escalus,
Though first in question, is thy secondary.
Take thy commission.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Now, good my lord,
Let there be some more test made of my metal,
Before so noble and so great a figure
Be stamp'd upon it.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: No more evasion:
We have with a leaven'd and prepared choice
Proceeded to you; therefore take your honours.
Our haste from hence is of so quick condition
That it prefers itself and leaves unquestion'd
Matters of needful value. We shall write to you,
As time and our concernings shall importune,
How it goes with us, and do look to know
What doth befall you here. So, fare you well;
To the hopeful execution do I leave you
Of your commissions.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Yet give leave, my lord,
That we may bring you something on the way.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: My haste may not admit it;
Nor need you, on mine honour, have to do
With any scruple; your scope is as mine own
So to enforce or qualify the laws
As to your soul seems good. Give me your hand:
I'll privily away. I love the people,
But do not like to stage me to their eyes:
Through it do well, I do not relish well
Their loud applause and Aves vehement;
Nor do I think the man of safe discretion
That does affect it. Once more, fare you well.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: The heavens give safety to your purposes!

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Lead forth and bring you back in happiness!

SPEAKER: DUKE
LINE: I thank you. Fare you well.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: I shall desire you, sir, to give me leave
To have free speech with you; and it concerns me
To look into the bottom of my place:
A power I have, but of what strength and nature
I am not yet instructed.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: 'Tis so with me. Let us withdraw together,
And we may soon our satisfaction have
Touching that point.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: I'll wait upon your honour.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II.  A Street.
STAGEDIR: Enter Provost, CLAUDIO, JULIET, and Officers

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: If the duke with the other dukes come not to
composition with the King of Hungary, why then all
the dukes fall upon the king.

SPEAKER: First Gentleman
LINE: Heaven grant us its peace, but not the King of
Hungary's!

SPEAKER: Second Gentleman
LINE: Amen.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Thou concludest like the sanctimonious pirate, that
went to sea with the Ten Commandments, but scraped
one out of the table.

SPEAKER: Second Gentleman
LINE: 'Thou shalt not steal'?

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Ay, that he razed.

SPEAKER: First Gentleman
LINE: Why, 'twas a commandment to command the captain and
all the rest from their functions: they put forth
to steal. There's not a soldier of us all, that, in
the thanksgiving before meat, do relish the petition
well that prays for peace.

SPEAKER: Second Gentleman
LINE: I never heard any soldier dislike it.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: I believe thee; for I think thou never wast where
grace was said.

SPEAKER: Second Gentleman
LINE: No? a dozen times at least.

SPEAKER: First Gentleman
LINE: What, in metre?

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: In any proportion or in any language.

SPEAKER: First Gentleman
LINE: I think, or in any religion.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Ay, why not? Grace is grace, despite of all
controversy: as, for example, thou thyself art a
wicked villain, despite of all grace.

SPEAKER: First Gentleman
LINE: Well, there went but a pair of shears between us.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: I grant; as there may between the lists and the
velvet. Thou art the list.

SPEAKER: First Gentleman
LINE: And thou the velvet: thou art good velvet; thou'rt
a three-piled piece, I warrant thee: I had as lief
be a list of an English kersey as be piled, as thou
art piled, for a French velvet. Do I speak
feelingly now?

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: I think thou dost; and, indeed, with most painful
feeling of thy speech: I will, out of thine own
confession, learn to begin thy health; but, whilst I
live, forget to drink after thee.

SPEAKER: First Gentleman
LINE: I think I have done myself wrong, have I not?

SPEAKER: Second Gentleman
LINE: Yes, that thou hast, whether thou art tainted or free.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Behold, behold. where Madam Mitigation comes! I
have purchased as many diseases under her roof as come to--

SPEAKER: Second Gentleman
LINE: To what, I pray?

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Judge.

SPEAKER: Second Gentleman
LINE: To three thousand dolours a year.

SPEAKER: First Gentleman
LINE: Ay, and more.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: A French crown more.

SPEAKER: First Gentleman
LINE: Thou art always figuring diseases in me; but thou
art full of error; I am sound.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Nay, not as one would say, healthy; but so sound as
things that are hollow: thy bones are hollow;
impiety has made a feast of thee.

SPEAKER: First Gentleman
LINE: How now! which of your hips has the most profound sciatica?

SPEAKER: MISTRESS OVERDONE
LINE: Well, well; there's one yonder arrested and carried
to prison was worth five thousand of you all.

SPEAKER: Second Gentleman
LINE: Who's that, I pray thee?

SPEAKER: MISTRESS OVERDONE
LINE: Marry, sir, that's Claudio, Signior Claudio.

SPEAKER: First Gentleman
LINE: Claudio to prison? 'tis not so.

SPEAKER: MISTRESS OVERDONE
LINE: Nay, but I know 'tis so: I saw him arrested, saw
him carried away; and, which is more, within these
three days his head to be chopped off.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: But, after all this fooling, I would not have it so.
Art thou sure of this?

SPEAKER: MISTRESS OVERDONE
LINE: I am too sure of it: and it is for getting Madam
Julietta with child.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Believe me, this may be: he promised to meet me two
hours since, and he was ever precise in
promise-keeping.

SPEAKER: Second Gentleman
LINE: Besides, you know, it draws something near to the
speech we had to such a purpose.

SPEAKER: First Gentleman
LINE: But, most of all, agreeing with the proclamation.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Away! let's go learn the truth of it.

SPEAKER: MISTRESS OVERDONE
LINE: Thus, what with the war, what with the sweat, what
with the gallows and what with poverty, I am
custom-shrunk.
How now! what's the news with you?

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Yonder man is carried to prison.

SPEAKER: MISTRESS OVERDONE
LINE: Well; what has he done?

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: A woman.

SPEAKER: MISTRESS OVERDONE
LINE: But what's his offence?

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Groping for trouts in a peculiar river.

SPEAKER: MISTRESS OVERDONE
LINE: What, is there a maid with child by him?

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: No, but there's a woman with maid by him. You have
not heard of the proclamation, have you?

SPEAKER: MISTRESS OVERDONE
LINE: What proclamation, man?

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: All houses in the suburbs of Vienna must be plucked down.

SPEAKER: MISTRESS OVERDONE
LINE: And what shall become of those in the city?

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: They shall stand for seed: they had gone down too,
but that a wise burgher put in for them.

SPEAKER: MISTRESS OVERDONE
LINE: But shall all our houses of resort in the suburbs be
pulled down?

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: To the ground, mistress.

SPEAKER: MISTRESS OVERDONE
LINE: Why, here's a change indeed in the commonwealth!
What shall become of me?

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Come; fear you not: good counsellors lack no
clients: though you change your place, you need not
change your trade; I'll be your tapster still.
Courage! there will be pity taken on you: you that
have worn your eyes almost out in the service, you
will be considered.

SPEAKER: MISTRESS OVERDONE
LINE: What's to do here, Thomas tapster? let's withdraw.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Here comes Signior Claudio, led by the provost to
prison; and there's Madam Juliet.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: Fellow, why dost thou show me thus to the world?
Bear me to prison, where I am committed.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: I do it not in evil disposition,
But from Lord Angelo by special charge.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: Thus can the demigod Authority
Make us pay down for our offence by weight
The words of heaven; on whom it will, it will;
On whom it will not, so; yet still 'tis just.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Why, how now, Claudio! whence comes this restraint?

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: From too much liberty, my Lucio, liberty:
As surfeit is the father of much fast,
So every scope by the immoderate use
Turns to restraint. Our natures do pursue,
Like rats that ravin down their proper bane,
A thirsty evil; and when we drink we die.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: If could speak so wisely under an arrest, I would
send for certain of my creditors: and yet, to say
the truth, I had as lief have the foppery of freedom
as the morality of imprisonment. What's thy
offence, Claudio?

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: What but to speak of would offend again.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: What, is't murder?

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: No.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Lechery?

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: Call it so.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: Away, sir! you must go.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: One word, good friend. Lucio, a word with you.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: A hundred, if they'll do you any good.
Is lechery so look'd after?

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: Thus stands it with me: upon a true contract
I got possession of Julietta's bed:
You know the lady; she is fast my wife,
Save that we do the denunciation lack
Of outward order: this we came not to,
Only for propagation of a dower
Remaining in the coffer of her friends,
From whom we thought it meet to hide our love
Till time had made them for us. But it chances
The stealth of our most mutual entertainment
With character too gross is writ on Juliet.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: With child, perhaps?

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: Unhappily, even so.
And the new deputy now for the duke--
Whether it be the fault and glimpse of newness,
Or whether that the body public be
A horse whereon the governor doth ride,
Who, newly in the seat, that it may know
He can command, lets it straight feel the spur;
Whether the tyranny be in his place,
Or in his emmence that fills it up,
I stagger in:--but this new governor
Awakes me all the enrolled penalties
Which have, like unscour'd armour, hung by the wall
So long that nineteen zodiacs have gone round
And none of them been worn; and, for a name,
Now puts the drowsy and neglected act
Freshly on me: 'tis surely for a name.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: I warrant it is: and thy head stands so tickle on
thy shoulders that a milkmaid, if she be in love,
may sigh it off. Send after the duke and appeal to
him.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: I have done so, but he's not to be found.
I prithee, Lucio, do me this kind service:
This day my sister should the cloister enter
And there receive her approbation:
Acquaint her with the danger of my state:
Implore her, in my voice, that she make friends
To the strict deputy; bid herself assay him:
I have great hope in that; for in her youth
There is a prone and speechless dialect,
Such as move men; beside, she hath prosperous art
When she will play with reason and discourse,
And well she can persuade.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: I pray she may; as well for the encouragement of the
like, which else would stand under grievous
imposition, as for the enjoying of thy life, who I
would be sorry should be thus foolishly lost at a
game of tick-tack. I'll to her.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: I thank you, good friend Lucio.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Within two hours.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: Come, officer, away!

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III.  A monastery.
STAGEDIR: Enter DUKE VINCENTIO and FRIAR THOMAS

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: No, holy father; throw away that thought;
Believe not that the dribbling dart of love
Can pierce a complete bosom. Why I desire thee
To give me secret harbour, hath a purpose
More grave and wrinkled than the aims and ends
Of burning youth.

SPEAKER: FRIAR THOMAS
LINE: May your grace speak of it?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: My holy sir, none better knows than you
How I have ever loved the life removed
And held in idle price to haunt assemblies
Where youth, and cost, and witless bravery keeps.
I have deliver'd to Lord Angelo,
A man of stricture and firm abstinence,
My absolute power and place here in Vienna,
And he supposes me travell'd to Poland;
For so I have strew'd it in the common ear,
And so it is received. Now, pious sir,
You will demand of me why I do this?

SPEAKER: FRIAR THOMAS
LINE: Gladly, my lord.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: We have strict statutes and most biting laws.
The needful bits and curbs to headstrong weeds,
Which for this nineteen years we have let slip;
Even like an o'ergrown lion in a cave,
That goes not out to prey. Now, as fond fathers,
Having bound up the threatening twigs of birch,
Only to stick it in their children's sight
For terror, not to use, in time the rod
Becomes more mock'd than fear'd; so our decrees,
Dead to infliction, to themselves are dead;
And liberty plucks justice by the nose;
The baby beats the nurse, and quite athwart
Goes all decorum.

SPEAKER: FRIAR THOMAS
LINE: It rested in your grace
To unloose this tied-up justice when you pleased:
And it in you more dreadful would have seem'd
Than in Lord Angelo.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: I do fear, too dreadful:
Sith 'twas my fault to give the people scope,
'Twould be my tyranny to strike and gall them
For what I bid them do: for we bid this be done,
When evil deeds have their permissive pass
And not the punishment. Therefore indeed, my father,
I have on Angelo imposed the office;
Who may, in the ambush of my name, strike home,
And yet my nature never in the fight
To do in slander. And to behold his sway,
I will, as 'twere a brother of your order,
Visit both prince and people: therefore, I prithee,
Supply me with the habit and instruct me
How I may formally in person bear me
Like a true friar. More reasons for this action
At our more leisure shall I render you;
Only, this one: Lord Angelo is precise;
Stands at a guard with envy; scarce confesses
That his blood flows, or that his appetite
Is more to bread than stone: hence shall we see,
If power change purpose, what our seemers be.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: And have you nuns no farther privileges?

SPEAKER: FRANCISCA
LINE: Are not these large enough?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Yes, truly; I speak not as desiring more;
But rather wishing a more strict restraint
Upon the sisterhood, the votarists of Saint Clare.

LINE.__text: Ho! Peace be in this place!

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Who's that which calls?

SPEAKER: FRANCISCA
LINE: It is a man's voice. Gentle Isabella,
Turn you the key, and know his business of him;
You may, I may not; you are yet unsworn.
When you have vow'd, you must not speak with men
But in the presence of the prioress:
Then, if you speak, you must not show your face,
Or, if you show your face, you must not speak.
He calls again; I pray you, answer him.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Peace and prosperity! Who is't that calls

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Hail, virgin, if you be, as those cheek-roses
Proclaim you are no less! Can you so stead me
As bring me to the sight of Isabella,
A novice of this place and the fair sister
To her unhappy brother Claudio?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Why 'her unhappy brother'? let me ask,
The rather for I now must make you know
I am that Isabella and his sister.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Gentle and fair, your brother kindly greets you:
Not to be weary with you, he's in prison.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Woe me! for what?

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: For that which, if myself might be his judge,
He should receive his punishment in thanks:
He hath got his friend with child.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Sir, make me not your story.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: It is true.
I would not--though 'tis my familiar sin
With maids to seem the lapwing and to jest,
Tongue far from heart--play with all virgins so:
I hold you as a thing ensky'd and sainted.
By your renouncement an immortal spirit,
And to be talk'd with in sincerity,
As with a saint.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: You do blaspheme the good in mocking me.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Do not believe it. Fewness and truth, 'tis thus:
Your brother and his lover have embraced:
As those that feed grow full, as blossoming time
That from the seedness the bare fallow brings
To teeming foison, even so her plenteous womb
Expresseth his full tilth and husbandry.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Some one with child by him? My cousin Juliet?

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Is she your cousin?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Adoptedly; as school-maids change their names
By vain though apt affection.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: She it is.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: O, let him marry her.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: This is the point.
The duke is very strangely gone from hence;
Bore many gentlemen, myself being one,
In hand and hope of action: but we do learn
By those that know the very nerves of state,
His givings-out were of an infinite distance
From his true-meant design. Upon his place,
And with full line of his authority,
Governs Lord Angelo; a man whose blood
Is very snow-broth; one who never feels
The wanton stings and motions of the sense,
But doth rebate and blunt his natural edge
With profits of the mind, study and fast.
He--to give fear to use and liberty,
Which have for long run by the hideous law,
As mice by lions--hath pick'd out an act,
Under whose heavy sense your brother's life
Falls into forfeit: he arrests him on it;
And follows close the rigour of the statute,
To make him an example. All hope is gone,
Unless you have the grace by your fair prayer
To soften Angelo: and that's my pith of business
'Twixt you and your poor brother.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Doth he so seek his life?

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Has censured him
Already; and, as I hear, the provost hath
A warrant for his execution.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Alas! what poor ability's in me
To do him good?

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Assay the power you have.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: My power? Alas, I doubt--

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Our doubts are traitors
And make us lose the good we oft might win
By fearing to attempt. Go to Lord Angelo,
And let him learn to know, when maidens sue,
Men give like gods; but when they weep and kneel,
All their petitions are as freely theirs
As they themselves would owe them.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: I'll see what I can do.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: But speedily.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: I will about it straight;
No longer staying but to give the mother
Notice of my affair. I humbly thank you:
Commend me to my brother: soon at night
I'll send him certain word of my success.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: I take my leave of you.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Good sir, adieu.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I.  A hall In ANGELO's house.
STAGEDIR:
Enter ANGELO, ESCALUS, and a Justice, Provost,
Officers, and other Attendants, behind
Enter ELBOW, and Officers with FROTH and POMPEY

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: We must not make a scarecrow of the law,
Setting it up to fear the birds of prey,
And let it keep one shape, till custom make it
Their perch and not their terror.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Ay, but yet
Let us be keen, and rather cut a little,
Than fall, and bruise to death. Alas, this gentleman
Whom I would save, had a most noble father!
Let but your honour know,
Whom I believe to be most strait in virtue,
That, in the working of your own affections,
Had time cohered with place or place with wishing,
Or that the resolute acting of your blood
Could have attain'd the effect of your own purpose,
Whether you had not sometime in your life
Err'd in this point which now you censure him,
And pull'd the law upon you.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: 'Tis one thing to be tempted, Escalus,
Another thing to fall. I not deny,
The jury, passing on the prisoner's life,
May in the sworn twelve have a thief or two
Guiltier than him they try. What's open made to justice,
That justice seizes: what know the laws
That thieves do pass on thieves? 'Tis very pregnant,
The jewel that we find, we stoop and take't
Because we see it; but what we do not see
We tread upon, and never think of it.
You may not so extenuate his offence
For I have had such faults; but rather tell me,
When I, that censure him, do so offend,
Let mine own judgment pattern out my death,
And nothing come in partial. Sir, he must die.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Be it as your wisdom will.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Where is the provost?

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: Here, if it like your honour.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: See that Claudio
Be executed by nine to-morrow morning:
Bring him his confessor, let him be prepared;
For that's the utmost of his pilgrimage.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS

LINE.__text: Well, heaven forgive him! and forgive us all!

LINE: Some rise by sin, and some by virtue fall:
Some run from brakes of ice, and answer none:
And some condemned for a fault alone.

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: Come, bring them away: if these be good people in
a commonweal that do nothing but use their abuses in
common houses, I know no law: bring them away.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: How now, sir! What's your name? and what's the matter?

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: If it Please your honour, I am the poor duke's
constable, and my name is Elbow: I do lean upon
justice, sir, and do bring in here before your good
honour two notorious benefactors.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Benefactors? Well; what benefactors are they? are
they not malefactors?

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: If it? please your honour, I know not well what they
are: but precise villains they are, that I am sure
of; and void of all profanation in the world that
good Christians ought to have.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: This comes off well; here's a wise officer.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Go to: what quality are they of? Elbow is your
name? why dost thou not speak, Elbow?

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: He cannot, sir; he's out at elbow.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: What are you, sir?

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: He, sir! a tapster, sir; parcel-bawd; one that
serves a bad woman; whose house, sir, was, as they
say, plucked down in the suburbs; and now she
professes a hot-house, which, I think, is a very ill house too.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: How know you that?

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: My wife, sir, whom I detest before heaven and your honour,--

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: How? thy wife?

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: Ay, sir; whom, I thank heaven, is an honest woman,--

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Dost thou detest her therefore?

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: I say, sir, I will detest myself also, as well as
she, that this house, if it be not a bawd's house,
it is pity of her life, for it is a naughty house.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: How dost thou know that, constable?

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: Marry, sir, by my wife; who, if she had been a woman
cardinally given, might have been accused in
fornication, adultery, and all uncleanliness there.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: By the woman's means?

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: Ay, sir, by Mistress Overdone's means: but as she
spit in his face, so she defied him.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Sir, if it please your honour, this is not so.

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: Prove it before these varlets here, thou honourable
man; prove it.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Do you hear how he misplaces?

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Sir, she came in great with child; and longing,
saving your honour's reverence, for stewed prunes;
sir, we had but two in the house, which at that very
distant time stood, as it were, in a fruit-dish, a
dish of some three-pence; your honours have seen
such dishes; they are not China dishes, but very
good dishes,--

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Go to, go to: no matter for the dish, sir.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: No, indeed, sir, not of a pin; you are therein in
the right: but to the point. As I say, this
Mistress Elbow, being, as I say, with child, and
being great-bellied, and longing, as I said, for
prunes; and having but two in the dish, as I said,
Master Froth here, this very man, having eaten the
rest, as I said, and, as I say, paying for them very
honestly; for, as you know, Master Froth, I could
not give you three-pence again.

SPEAKER: FROTH
LINE: No, indeed.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Very well: you being then, if you be remembered,
cracking the stones of the foresaid prunes,--

SPEAKER: FROTH
LINE: Ay, so I did indeed.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Why, very well; I telling you then, if you be
remembered, that such a one and such a one were past
cure of the thing you wot of, unless they kept very
good diet, as I told you,--

SPEAKER: FROTH
LINE: All this is true.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Why, very well, then,--

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Come, you are a tedious fool: to the purpose. What
was done to Elbow's wife, that he hath cause to
complain of? Come me to what was done to her.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Sir, your honour cannot come to that yet.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: No, sir, nor I mean it not.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Sir, but you shall come to it, by your honour's
leave. And, I beseech you, look into Master Froth
here, sir; a man of four-score pound a year; whose
father died at Hallowmas: was't not at Hallowmas,
Master Froth?

SPEAKER: FROTH
LINE: All-hallond eve.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Why, very well; I hope here be truths. He, sir,
sitting, as I say, in a lower chair, sir; 'twas in
the Bunch of Grapes, where indeed you have a delight
to sit, have you not?

SPEAKER: FROTH
LINE: I have so; because it is an open room and good for winter.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Why, very well, then; I hope here be truths.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: This will last out a night in Russia,
When nights are longest there: I'll take my leave.
And leave you to the hearing of the cause;
Hoping you'll find good cause to whip them all.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: I think no less. Good morrow to your lordship.
Now, sir, come on: what was done to Elbow's wife, once more?

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Once, sir? there was nothing done to her once.

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: I beseech you, sir, ask him what this man did to my wife.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: I beseech your honour, ask me.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Well, sir; what did this gentleman to her?

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: I beseech you, sir, look in this gentleman's face.
Good Master Froth, look upon his honour; 'tis for a
good purpose. Doth your honour mark his face?

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Ay, sir, very well.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Nay; I beseech you, mark it well.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Well, I do so.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Doth your honour see any harm in his face?

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Why, no.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: I'll be supposed upon a book, his face is the worst
thing about him. Good, then; if his face be the
worst thing about him, how could Master Froth do the
constable's wife any harm? I would know that of
your honour.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: He's in the right. Constable, what say you to it?

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: First, an it like you, the house is a respected
house; next, this is a respected fellow; and his
mistress is a respected woman.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: By this hand, sir, his wife is a more respected
person than any of us all.

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: Varlet, thou liest; thou liest, wicked varlet! the
time has yet to come that she was ever respected
with man, woman, or child.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Sir, she was respected with him before he married with her.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Which is the wiser here? Justice or Iniquity? Is
this true?

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: O thou caitiff! O thou varlet! O thou wicked
Hannibal! I respected with her before I was married
to her! If ever I was respected with her, or she
with me, let not your worship think me the poor
duke's officer. Prove this, thou wicked Hannibal, or
I'll have mine action of battery on thee.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: If he took you a box o' the ear, you might have your
action of slander too.

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: Marry, I thank your good worship for it. What is't
your worship's pleasure I shall do with this wicked caitiff?

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Truly, officer, because he hath some offences in him
that thou wouldst discover if thou couldst, let him
continue in his courses till thou knowest what they
are.

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: Marry, I thank your worship for it. Thou seest, thou
wicked varlet, now, what's come upon thee: thou art
to continue now, thou varlet; thou art to continue.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Where were you born, friend?

SPEAKER: FROTH
LINE: Here in Vienna, sir.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Are you of fourscore pounds a year?

SPEAKER: FROTH
LINE: Yes, an't please you, sir.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: So. What trade are you of, sir?

SPEAKER: POMPHEY
LINE: Tapster; a poor widow's tapster.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Your mistress' name?

SPEAKER: POMPHEY
LINE: Mistress Overdone.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Hath she had any more than one husband?

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Nine, sir; Overdone by the last.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Nine! Come hither to me, Master Froth. Master
Froth, I would not have you acquainted with
tapsters: they will draw you, Master Froth, and you
will hang them. Get you gone, and let me hear no
more of you.

SPEAKER: FROTH
LINE: I thank your worship. For mine own part, I never
come into any room in a tap-house, but I am drawn
in.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Well, no more of it, Master Froth: farewell.
Come you hither to me, Master tapster. What's your
name, Master tapster?

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Pompey.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: What else?

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Bum, sir.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Troth, and your bum is the greatest thing about you;
so that in the beastliest sense you are Pompey the
Great. Pompey, you are partly a bawd, Pompey,
howsoever you colour it in being a tapster, are you
not? come, tell me true: it shall be the better for you.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Truly, sir, I am a poor fellow that would live.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: How would you live, Pompey? by being a bawd? What
do you think of the trade, Pompey? is it a lawful trade?

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: If the law would allow it, sir.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: But the law will not allow it, Pompey; nor it shall
not be allowed in Vienna.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Does your worship mean to geld and splay all the
youth of the city?

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: No, Pompey.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Truly, sir, in my poor opinion, they will to't then.
If your worship will take order for the drabs and
the knaves, you need not to fear the bawds.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: There are pretty orders beginning, I can tell you:
it is but heading and hanging.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: If you head and hang all that offend that way but
for ten year together, you'll be glad to give out a
commission for more heads: if this law hold in
Vienna ten year, I'll rent the fairest house in it
after three-pence a bay: if you live to see this
come to pass, say Pompey told you so.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Thank you, good Pompey; and, in requital of your
prophecy, hark you: I advise you, let me not find
you before me again upon any complaint whatsoever;
no, not for dwelling where you do: if I do, Pompey,
I shall beat you to your tent, and prove a shrewd
Caesar to you; in plain dealing, Pompey, I shall
have you whipt: so, for this time, Pompey, fare you well.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: I thank your worship for your good counsel:
but I shall follow it as the flesh and fortune shall
better determine.
Whip me? No, no; let carman whip his jade:
The valiant heart is not whipt out of his trade.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Come hither to me, Master Elbow; come hither, Master
constable. How long have you been in this place of constable?

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: Seven year and a half, sir.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: I thought, by your readiness in the office, you had
continued in it some time. You say, seven years together?

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: And a half, sir.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Alas, it hath been great pains to you. They do you
wrong to put you so oft upon 't: are there not men
in your ward sufficient to serve it?

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: Faith, sir, few of any wit in such matters: as they
are chosen, they are glad to choose me for them; I
do it for some piece of money, and go through with
all.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Look you bring me in the names of some six or seven,
the most sufficient of your parish.

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: To your worship's house, sir?

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: To my house. Fare you well.
What's o'clock, think you?

SPEAKER: Justice
LINE: Eleven, sir.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: I pray you home to dinner with me.

SPEAKER: Justice
LINE: I humbly thank you.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: It grieves me for the death of Claudio;
But there's no remedy.

SPEAKER: Justice
LINE: Lord Angelo is severe.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: It is but needful:
Mercy is not itself, that oft looks so;
Pardon is still the nurse of second woe:
But yet,--poor Claudio! There is no remedy.
Come, sir.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II.  Another room in the same.

SPEAKER: Servant
LINE: He's hearing of a cause; he will come straight
I'll tell him of you.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: Pray you, do.
I'll know
His pleasure; may be he will relent. Alas,
He hath but as offended in a dream!
All sects, all ages smack of this vice; and he
To die for't!

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Now, what's the matter. Provost?

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: Is it your will Claudio shall die tomorrow?

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Did not I tell thee yea? hadst thou not order?
Why dost thou ask again?

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: Lest I might be too rash:
Under your good correction, I have seen,
When, after execution, judgment hath
Repented o'er his doom.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Go to; let that be mine:
Do you your office, or give up your place,
And you shall well be spared.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: I crave your honour's pardon.
What shall be done, sir, with the groaning Juliet?
She's very near her hour.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Dispose of her
To some more fitter place, and that with speed.

SPEAKER: Servant
LINE: Here is the sister of the man condemn'd
Desires access to you.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Hath he a sister?

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: Ay, my good lord; a very virtuous maid,
And to be shortly of a sisterhood,
If not already.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Well, let her be admitted.
See you the fornicatress be removed:
Let have needful, but not lavish, means;
There shall be order for't.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: God save your honour!

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Stay a little while.
You're welcome: what's your will?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: I am a woeful suitor to your honour,
Please but your honour hear me.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Well; what's your suit?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: There is a vice that most I do abhor,
And most desire should meet the blow of justice;
For which I would not plead, but that I must;
For which I must not plead, but that I am
At war 'twixt will and will not.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Well; the matter?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: I have a brother is condemn'd to die:
I do beseech you, let it be his fault,
And not my brother.

LINE.__text: Heaven give thee moving graces!

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Condemn the fault and not the actor of it?
Why, every fault's condemn'd ere it be done:
Mine were the very cipher of a function,
To fine the faults whose fine stands in record,
And let go by the actor.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: O just but severe law!
I had a brother, then. Heaven keep your honour!

SPEAKER: LUCIO

LINE.__text: Give't not o'er so: to him

LINE: again, entreat him;
Kneel down before him, hang upon his gown:
You are too cold; if you should need a pin,
You could not with more tame a tongue desire it:
To him, I say!

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Must he needs die?

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Maiden, no remedy.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Yes; I do think that you might pardon him,
And neither heaven nor man grieve at the mercy.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: I will not do't.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: But can you, if you would?

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Look, what I will not, that I cannot do.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: But might you do't, and do the world no wrong,
If so your heart were touch'd with that remorse
As mine is to him?

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: He's sentenced; 'tis too late.

LINE.__text: You are too cold.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Too late? why, no; I, that do speak a word.
May call it back again. Well, believe this,
No ceremony that to great ones 'longs,
Not the king's crown, nor the deputed sword,
The marshal's truncheon, nor the judge's robe,
Become them with one half so good a grace
As mercy does.
If he had been as you and you as he,
You would have slipt like him; but he, like you,
Would not have been so stern.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Pray you, be gone.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: I would to heaven I had your potency,
And you were Isabel! should it then be thus?
No; I would tell what 'twere to be a judge,
And what a prisoner.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Ay, touch him; there's the vein.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Your brother is a forfeit of the law,
And you but waste your words.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Alas, alas!
Why, all the souls that were were forfeit once;
And He that might the vantage best have took
Found out the remedy. How would you be,
If He, which is the top of judgment, should
But judge you as you are? O, think on that;
And mercy then will breathe within your lips,
Like man new made.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Be you content, fair maid;
It is the law, not I condemn your brother:
Were he my kinsman, brother, or my son,
It should be thus with him: he must die tomorrow.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: To-morrow! O, that's sudden! Spare him, spare him!
He's not prepared for death. Even for our kitchens
We kill the fowl of season: shall we serve heaven
With less respect than we do minister
To our gross selves? Good, good my lord, bethink you;
Who is it that hath died for this offence?
There's many have committed it.

LINE.__text: Ay, well said.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: The law hath not been dead, though it hath slept:
Those many had not dared to do that evil,
If the first that did the edict infringe
Had answer'd for his deed: now 'tis awake
Takes note of what is done; and, like a prophet,
Looks in a glass, that shows what future evils,
Either new, or by remissness new-conceived,
And so in progress to be hatch'd and born,
Are now to have no successive degrees,
But, ere they live, to end.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Yet show some pity.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: I show it most of all when I show justice;
For then I pity those I do not know,
Which a dismiss'd offence would after gall;
And do him right that, answering one foul wrong,
Lives not to act another. Be satisfied;
Your brother dies to-morrow; be content.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: So you must be the first that gives this sentence,
And he, that suffer's. O, it is excellent
To have a giant's strength; but it is tyrannous
To use it like a giant.

LINE.__text: That's well said.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Could great men thunder
As Jove himself does, Jove would ne'er be quiet,
For every pelting, petty officer
Would use his heaven for thunder;
Nothing but thunder! Merciful Heaven,
Thou rather with thy sharp and sulphurous bolt
Split'st the unwedgeable and gnarled oak
Than the soft myrtle: but man, proud man,
Drest in a little brief authority,
Most ignorant of what he's most assured,
His glassy essence, like an angry ape,
Plays such fantastic tricks before high heaven
As make the angels weep; who, with our spleens,
Would all themselves laugh mortal.

SPEAKER: LUCIO

LINE.__text: O, to him, to him, wench! he

LINE: will relent;
He's coming; I perceive 't.

LINE.__text: Pray heaven she win him!

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: We cannot weigh our brother with ourself:
Great men may jest with saints; 'tis wit in them,
But in the less foul profanation.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Thou'rt i' the right, girl; more o, that.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: That in the captain's but a choleric word,
Which in the soldier is flat blasphemy.

LINE.__text: Art avised o' that? more on 't.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Why do you put these sayings upon me?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Because authority, though it err like others,
Hath yet a kind of medicine in itself,
That skins the vice o' the top. Go to your bosom;
Knock there, and ask your heart what it doth know
That's like my brother's fault: if it confess
A natural guiltiness such as is his,
Let it not sound a thought upon your tongue
Against my brother's life.

SPEAKER: ANGELO

LINE.__text: She speaks, and 'tis

LINE: Such sense, that my sense breeds with it. Fare you well.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Gentle my lord, turn back.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: I will bethink me: come again tomorrow.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Hark how I'll bribe you: good my lord, turn back.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: How! bribe me?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Ay, with such gifts that heaven shall share with you.

LINE.__text: You had marr'd all else.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Not with fond shekels of the tested gold,
Or stones whose rates are either rich or poor
As fancy values them; but with true prayers
That shall be up at heaven and enter there
Ere sun-rise, prayers from preserved souls,
From fasting maids whose minds are dedicate
To nothing temporal.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Well; come to me to-morrow.

LINE.__text: Go to; 'tis well; away!

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Heaven keep your honour safe!

SPEAKER: ANGELO

LINE.__text: Amen:

LINE: For I am that way going to temptation,
Where prayers cross.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: At what hour to-morrow
Shall I attend your lordship?

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: At any time 'fore noon.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: 'Save your honour!

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: From thee, even from thy virtue!
What's this, what's this? Is this her fault or mine?
The tempter or the tempted, who sins most?
Ha!
Not she: nor doth she tempt: but it is I
That, lying by the violet in the sun,
Do as the carrion does, not as the flower,
Corrupt with virtuous season. Can it be
That modesty may more betray our sense
Than woman's lightness? Having waste ground enough,
Shall we desire to raze the sanctuary
And pitch our evils there? O, fie, fie, fie!
What dost thou, or what art thou, Angelo?
Dost thou desire her foully for those things
That make her good? O, let her brother live!
Thieves for their robbery have authority
When judges steal themselves. What, do I love her,
That I desire to hear her speak again,
And feast upon her eyes? What is't I dream on?
O cunning enemy, that, to catch a saint,
With saints dost bait thy hook! Most dangerous
Is that temptation that doth goad us on
To sin in loving virtue: never could the strumpet,
With all her double vigour, art and nature,
Once stir my temper; but this virtuous maid
Subdues me quite. Even till now,
When men were fond, I smiled and wonder'd how.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III.  A room in a prison.
STAGEDIR:
Enter, severally, DUKE VINCENTIO disguised as a
friar, and Provost

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Hail to you, provost! so I think you are.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: I am the provost. What's your will, good friar?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Bound by my charity and my blest order,
I come to visit the afflicted spirits
Here in the prison. Do me the common right
To let me see them and to make me know
The nature of their crimes, that I may minister
To them accordingly.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: I would do more than that, if more were needful.
Look, here comes one: a gentlewoman of mine,
Who, falling in the flaws of her own youth,
Hath blister'd her report: she is with child;
And he that got it, sentenced; a young man
More fit to do another such offence
Than die for this.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: When must he die?

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: As I do think, to-morrow.
I have provided for you: stay awhile,
And you shall be conducted.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Repent you, fair one, of the sin you carry?

SPEAKER: JULIET
LINE: I do; and bear the shame most patiently.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: I'll teach you how you shall arraign your conscience,
And try your penitence, if it be sound,
Or hollowly put on.

SPEAKER: JULIET
LINE: I'll gladly learn.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Love you the man that wrong'd you?

SPEAKER: JULIET
LINE: Yes, as I love the woman that wrong'd him.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: So then it seems your most offenceful act
Was mutually committed?

SPEAKER: JULIET
LINE: Mutually.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Then was your sin of heavier kind than his.

SPEAKER: JULIET
LINE: I do confess it, and repent it, father.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: 'Tis meet so, daughter: but lest you do repent,
As that the sin hath brought you to this shame,
Which sorrow is always towards ourselves, not heaven,
Showing we would not spare heaven as we love it,
But as we stand in fear,--

SPEAKER: JULIET
LINE: I do repent me, as it is an evil,
And take the shame with joy.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: There rest.
Your partner, as I hear, must die to-morrow,
And I am going with instruction to him.
Grace go with you, Benedicite!

SPEAKER: JULIET
LINE: Must die to-morrow! O injurious love,
That respites me a life, whose very comfort
Is still a dying horror!

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: 'Tis pity of him.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV.  A room in ANGELO's house.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: When I would pray and think, I think and pray
To several subjects. Heaven hath my empty words;
Whilst my invention, hearing not my tongue,
Anchors on Isabel: Heaven in my mouth,
As if I did but only chew his name;
And in my heart the strong and swelling evil
Of my conception. The state, whereon I studied
Is like a good thing, being often read,
Grown fear'd and tedious; yea, my gravity,
Wherein--let no man hear me--I take pride,
Could I with boot change for an idle plume,
Which the air beats for vain. O place, O form,
How often dost thou with thy case, thy habit,
Wrench awe from fools and tie the wiser souls
To thy false seeming! Blood, thou art blood:
Let's write good angel on the devil's horn:
'Tis not the devil's crest.
How now! who's there?

SPEAKER: Servant
LINE: One Isabel, a sister, desires access to you.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Teach her the way.
O heavens!
Why does my blood thus muster to my heart,
Making both it unable for itself,
And dispossessing all my other parts
Of necessary fitness?
So play the foolish throngs with one that swoons;
Come all to help him, and so stop the air
By which he should revive: and even so
The general, subject to a well-wish'd king,
Quit their own part, and in obsequious fondness
Crowd to his presence, where their untaught love
Must needs appear offence.
How now, fair maid?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: I am come to know your pleasure.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: That you might know it, would much better please me
Than to demand what 'tis. Your brother cannot live.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Even so. Heaven keep your honour!

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Yet may he live awhile; and, it may be,
As long as you or I yet he must die.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Under your sentence?

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Yea.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: When, I beseech you? that in his reprieve,
Longer or shorter, he may be so fitted
That his soul sicken not.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Ha! fie, these filthy vices! It were as good
To pardon him that hath from nature stolen
A man already made, as to remit
Their saucy sweetness that do coin heaven's image
In stamps that are forbid: 'tis all as easy
Falsely to take away a life true made
As to put metal in restrained means
To make a false one.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: 'Tis set down so in heaven, but not in earth.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Say you so? then I shall pose you quickly.
Which had you rather, that the most just law
Now took your brother's life; or, to redeem him,
Give up your body to such sweet uncleanness
As she that he hath stain'd?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Sir, believe this,
I had rather give my body than my soul.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: I talk not of your soul: our compell'd sins
Stand more for number than for accompt.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: How say you?

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Nay, I'll not warrant that; for I can speak
Against the thing I say. Answer to this:
I, now the voice of the recorded law,
Pronounce a sentence on your brother's life:
Might there not be a charity in sin
To save this brother's life?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Please you to do't,
I'll take it as a peril to my soul,
It is no sin at all, but charity.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Pleased you to do't at peril of your soul,
Were equal poise of sin and charity.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: That I do beg his life, if it be sin,
Heaven let me bear it! you granting of my suit,
If that be sin, I'll make it my morn prayer
To have it added to the faults of mine,
And nothing of your answer.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Nay, but hear me.
Your sense pursues not mine: either you are ignorant,
Or seem so craftily; and that's not good.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Let me be ignorant, and in nothing good,
But graciously to know I am no better.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Thus wisdom wishes to appear most bright
When it doth tax itself; as these black masks
Proclaim an enshield beauty ten times louder
Than beauty could, display'd. But mark me;
To be received plain, I'll speak more gross:
Your brother is to die.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: So.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: And his offence is so, as it appears,
Accountant to the law upon that pain.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: True.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Admit no other way to save his life,--
As I subscribe not that, nor any other,
But in the loss of question,--that you, his sister,
Finding yourself desired of such a person,
Whose credit with the judge, or own great place,
Could fetch your brother from the manacles
Of the all-building law; and that there were
No earthly mean to save him, but that either
You must lay down the treasures of your body
To this supposed, or else to let him suffer;
What would you do?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: As much for my poor brother as myself:
That is, were I under the terms of death,
The impression of keen whips I'ld wear as rubies,
And strip myself to death, as to a bed
That longing have been sick for, ere I'ld yield
My body up to shame.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Then must your brother die.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: And 'twere the cheaper way:
Better it were a brother died at once,
Than that a sister, by redeeming him,
Should die for ever.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Were not you then as cruel as the sentence
That you have slander'd so?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Ignomy in ransom and free pardon
Are of two houses: lawful mercy
Is nothing kin to foul redemption.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: You seem'd of late to make the law a tyrant;
And rather proved the sliding of your brother
A merriment than a vice.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: O, pardon me, my lord; it oft falls out,
To have what we would have, we speak not what we mean:
I something do excuse the thing I hate,
For his advantage that I dearly love.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: We are all frail.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Else let my brother die,
If not a feodary, but only he
Owe and succeed thy weakness.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Nay, women are frail too.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Ay, as the glasses where they view themselves;
Which are as easy broke as they make forms.
Women! Help Heaven! men their creation mar
In profiting by them. Nay, call us ten times frail;
For we are soft as our complexions are,
And credulous to false prints.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: I think it well:
And from this testimony of your own sex,--
Since I suppose we are made to be no stronger
Than faults may shake our frames,--let me be bold;
I do arrest your words. Be that you are,
That is, a woman; if you be more, you're none;
If you be one, as you are well express'd
By all external warrants, show it now,
By putting on the destined livery.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: I have no tongue but one: gentle my lord,
Let me entreat you speak the former language.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Plainly conceive, I love you.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: My brother did love Juliet,
And you tell me that he shall die for it.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: He shall not, Isabel, if you give me love.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: I know your virtue hath a licence in't,
Which seems a little fouler than it is,
To pluck on others.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Believe me, on mine honour,
My words express my purpose.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Ha! little honour to be much believed,
And most pernicious purpose! Seeming, seeming!
I will proclaim thee, Angelo; look for't:
Sign me a present pardon for my brother,
Or with an outstretch'd throat I'll tell the world aloud
What man thou art.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Who will believe thee, Isabel?
My unsoil'd name, the austereness of my life,
My vouch against you, and my place i' the state,
Will so your accusation overweigh,
That you shall stifle in your own report
And smell of calumny. I have begun,
And now I give my sensual race the rein:
Fit thy consent to my sharp appetite;
Lay by all nicety and prolixious blushes,
That banish what they sue for; redeem thy brother
By yielding up thy body to my will;
Or else he must not only die the death,
But thy unkindness shall his death draw out
To lingering sufferance. Answer me to-morrow,
Or, by the affection that now guides me most,
I'll prove a tyrant to him. As for you,
Say what you can, my false o'erweighs your true.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: To whom should I complain? Did I tell this,
Who would believe me? O perilous mouths,
That bear in them one and the self-same tongue,
Either of condemnation or approof;
Bidding the law make court'sy to their will:
Hooking both right and wrong to the appetite,
To follow as it draws! I'll to my brother:
Though he hath fallen by prompture of the blood,
Yet hath he in him such a mind of honour.
That, had he twenty heads to tender down
On twenty bloody blocks, he'ld yield them up,
Before his sister should her body stoop
To such abhorr'd pollution.
Then, Isabel, live chaste, and, brother, die:
More than our brother is our chastity.
I'll tell him yet of Angelo's request,
And fit his mind to death, for his soul's rest.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I.  A room in the prison.
STAGEDIR:
Enter DUKE VINCENTIO disguised as before, CLAUDIO,
and Provost

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: So then you hope of pardon from Lord Angelo?

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: The miserable have no other medicine
But only hope:
I've hope to live, and am prepared to die.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Be absolute for death; either death or life
Shall thereby be the sweeter. Reason thus with life:
If I do lose thee, I do lose a thing
That none but fools would keep: a breath thou art,
Servile to all the skyey influences,
That dost this habitation, where thou keep'st,
Hourly afflict: merely, thou art death's fool;
For him thou labour'st by thy flight to shun
And yet runn'st toward him still. Thou art not noble;
For all the accommodations that thou bear'st
Are nursed by baseness. Thou'rt by no means valiant;
For thou dost fear the soft and tender fork
Of a poor worm. Thy best of rest is sleep,
And that thou oft provokest; yet grossly fear'st
Thy death, which is no more. Thou art not thyself;
For thou exist'st on many a thousand grains
That issue out of dust. Happy thou art not;
For what thou hast not, still thou strivest to get,
And what thou hast, forget'st. Thou art not certain;
For thy complexion shifts to strange effects,
After the moon. If thou art rich, thou'rt poor;
For, like an ass whose back with ingots bows,
Thou bear's thy heavy riches but a journey,
And death unloads thee. Friend hast thou none;
For thine own bowels, which do call thee sire,
The mere effusion of thy proper loins,
Do curse the gout, serpigo, and the rheum,
For ending thee no sooner. Thou hast nor youth nor age,
But, as it were, an after-dinner's sleep,
Dreaming on both; for all thy blessed youth
Becomes as aged, and doth beg the alms
Of palsied eld; and when thou art old and rich,
Thou hast neither heat, affection, limb, nor beauty,
To make thy riches pleasant. What's yet in this
That bears the name of life? Yet in this life
Lie hid moe thousand deaths: yet death we fear,
That makes these odds all even.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: I humbly thank you.
To sue to live, I find I seek to die;
And, seeking death, find life: let it come on.

LINE.__text: What, ho! Peace here; grace and good company!

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: Who's there? come in: the wish deserves a welcome.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Dear sir, ere long I'll visit you again.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: Most holy sir, I thank you.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: My business is a word or two with Claudio.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: And very welcome. Look, signior, here's your sister.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Provost, a word with you.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: As many as you please.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Bring me to hear them speak, where I may be concealed.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: Now, sister, what's the comfort?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Why,
As all comforts are; most good, most good indeed.
Lord Angelo, having affairs to heaven,
Intends you for his swift ambassador,
Where you shall be an everlasting leiger:
Therefore your best appointment make with speed;
To-morrow you set on.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: Is there no remedy?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: None, but such remedy as, to save a head,
To cleave a heart in twain.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: But is there any?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Yes, brother, you may live:
There is a devilish mercy in the judge,
If you'll implore it, that will free your life,
But fetter you till death.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: Perpetual durance?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Ay, just; perpetual durance, a restraint,
Though all the world's vastidity you had,
To a determined scope.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: But in what nature?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: In such a one as, you consenting to't,
Would bark your honour from that trunk you bear,
And leave you naked.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: Let me know the point.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: O, I do fear thee, Claudio; and I quake,
Lest thou a feverous life shouldst entertain,
And six or seven winters more respect
Than a perpetual honour. Darest thou die?
The sense of death is most in apprehension;
And the poor beetle, that we tread upon,
In corporal sufferance finds a pang as great
As when a giant dies.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: Why give you me this shame?
Think you I can a resolution fetch
From flowery tenderness? If I must die,
I will encounter darkness as a bride,
And hug it in mine arms.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: There spake my brother; there my father's grave
Did utter forth a voice. Yes, thou must die:
Thou art too noble to conserve a life
In base appliances. This outward-sainted deputy,
Whose settled visage and deliberate word
Nips youth i' the head and follies doth emmew
As falcon doth the fowl, is yet a devil
His filth within being cast, he would appear
A pond as deep as hell.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: The prenzie Angelo!

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: O, 'tis the cunning livery of hell,
The damned'st body to invest and cover
In prenzie guards! Dost thou think, Claudio?
If I would yield him my virginity,
Thou mightst be freed.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: O heavens! it cannot be.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Yes, he would give't thee, from this rank offence,
So to offend him still. This night's the time
That I should do what I abhor to name,
Or else thou diest to-morrow.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: Thou shalt not do't.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: O, were it but my life,
I'ld throw it down for your deliverance
As frankly as a pin.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: Thanks, dear Isabel.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Be ready, Claudio, for your death tomorrow.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: Yes. Has he affections in him,
That thus can make him bite the law by the nose,
When he would force it? Sure, it is no sin,
Or of the deadly seven, it is the least.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Which is the least?

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: If it were damnable, he being so wise,
Why would he for the momentary trick
Be perdurably fined? O Isabel!

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: What says my brother?

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: Death is a fearful thing.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: And shamed life a hateful.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: Ay, but to die, and go we know not where;
To lie in cold obstruction and to rot;
This sensible warm motion to become
A kneaded clod; and the delighted spirit
To bathe in fiery floods, or to reside
In thrilling region of thick-ribbed ice;
To be imprison'd in the viewless winds,
And blown with restless violence round about
The pendent world; or to be worse than worst
Of those that lawless and incertain thought
Imagine howling: 'tis too horrible!
The weariest and most loathed worldly life
That age, ache, penury and imprisonment
Can lay on nature is a paradise
To what we fear of death.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Alas, alas!

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: Sweet sister, let me live:
What sin you do to save a brother's life,
Nature dispenses with the deed so far
That it becomes a virtue.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: O you beast!
O faithless coward! O dishonest wretch!
Wilt thou be made a man out of my vice?
Is't not a kind of incest, to take life
From thine own sister's shame? What should I think?
Heaven shield my mother play'd my father fair!
For such a warped slip of wilderness
Ne'er issued from his blood. Take my defiance!
Die, perish! Might but my bending down
Reprieve thee from thy fate, it should proceed:
I'll pray a thousand prayers for thy death,
No word to save thee.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: Nay, hear me, Isabel.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: O, fie, fie, fie!
Thy sin's not accidental, but a trade.
Mercy to thee would prove itself a bawd:
'Tis best thou diest quickly.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: O hear me, Isabella!

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Vouchsafe a word, young sister, but one word.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: What is your will?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Might you dispense with your leisure, I would by and
by have some speech with you: the satisfaction I
would require is likewise your own benefit.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: I have no superfluous leisure; my stay must be
stolen out of other affairs; but I will attend you awhile.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Son, I have overheard what hath passed between you
and your sister. Angelo had never the purpose to
corrupt her; only he hath made an essay of her
virtue to practise his judgment with the disposition
of natures: she, having the truth of honour in her,
hath made him that gracious denial which he is most
glad to receive. I am confessor to Angelo, and I
know this to be true; therefore prepare yourself to
death: do not satisfy your resolution with hopes
that are fallible: tomorrow you must die; go to
your knees and make ready.

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: Let me ask my sister pardon. I am so out of love
with life that I will sue to be rid of it.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Hold you there: farewell.
Provost, a word with you!

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: What's your will, father

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: That now you are come, you will be gone. Leave me
awhile with the maid: my mind promises with my
habit no loss shall touch her by my company.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: In good time.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: The hand that hath made you fair hath made you good:
the goodness that is cheap in beauty makes beauty
brief in goodness; but grace, being the soul of
your complexion, shall keep the body of it ever
fair. The assault that Angelo hath made to you,
fortune hath conveyed to my understanding; and, but
that frailty hath examples for his falling, I should
wonder at Angelo. How will you do to content this
substitute, and to save your brother?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: I am now going to resolve him: I had rather my
brother die by the law than my son should be
unlawfully born. But, O, how much is the good duke
deceived in Angelo! If ever he return and I can
speak to him, I will open my lips in vain, or
discover his government.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: That shall not be much amiss: Yet, as the matter
now stands, he will avoid your accusation; he made
trial of you only. Therefore fasten your ear on my
advisings: to the love I have in doing good a
remedy presents itself. I do make myself believe
that you may most uprighteously do a poor wronged
lady a merited benefit; redeem your brother from
the angry law; do no stain to your own gracious
person; and much please the absent duke, if
peradventure he shall ever return to have hearing of
this business.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Let me hear you speak farther. I have spirit to do
anything that appears not foul in the truth of my spirit.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Virtue is bold, and goodness never fearful. Have
you not heard speak of Mariana, the sister of
Frederick the great soldier who miscarried at sea?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: I have heard of the lady, and good words went with her name.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: She should this Angelo have married; was affianced
to her by oath, and the nuptial appointed: between
which time of the contract and limit of the
solemnity, her brother Frederick was wrecked at sea,
having in that perished vessel the dowry of his
sister. But mark how heavily this befell to the
poor gentlewoman: there she lost a noble and
renowned brother, in his love toward her ever most
kind and natural; with him, the portion and sinew of
her fortune, her marriage-dowry; with both, her
combinate husband, this well-seeming Angelo.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Can this be so? did Angelo so leave her?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Left her in her tears, and dried not one of them
with his comfort; swallowed his vows whole,
pretending in her discoveries of dishonour: in few,
bestowed her on her own lamentation, which she yet
wears for his sake; and he, a marble to her tears,
is washed with them, but relents not.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: What a merit were it in death to take this poor maid
from the world! What corruption in this life, that
it will let this man live! But how out of this can she avail?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: It is a rupture that you may easily heal: and the
cure of it not only saves your brother, but keeps
you from dishonour in doing it.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Show me how, good father.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: This forenamed maid hath yet in her the continuance
of her first affection: his unjust unkindness, that
in all reason should have quenched her love, hath,
like an impediment in the current, made it more
violent and unruly. Go you to Angelo; answer his
requiring with a plausible obedience; agree with
his demands to the point; only refer yourself to
this advantage, first, that your stay with him may
not be long; that the time may have all shadow and
silence in it; and the place answer to convenience.
This being granted in course,--and now follows
all,--we shall advise this wronged maid to stead up
your appointment, go in your place; if the encounter
acknowledge itself hereafter, it may compel him to
her recompense: and here, by this, is your brother
saved, your honour untainted, the poor Mariana
advantaged, and the corrupt deputy scaled. The maid
will I frame and make fit for his attempt. If you
think well to carry this as you may, the doubleness
of the benefit defends the deceit from reproof.
What think you of it?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: The image of it gives me content already; and I
trust it will grow to a most prosperous perfection.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: It lies much in your holding up. Haste you speedily
to Angelo: if for this night he entreat you to his
bed, give him promise of satisfaction. I will
presently to Saint Luke's: there, at the moated
grange, resides this dejected Mariana. At that
place call upon me; and dispatch with Angelo, that
it may be quickly.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: I thank you for this comfort. Fare you well, good father.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II.  The street before the prison.
STAGEDIR:
Enter, on one side, DUKE VINCENTIO disguised as
before; on the other, ELBOW, and Officers with POMPEY
Enter ESCALUS, Provost, and Officers with MISTRESS OVERDONE

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: Nay, if there be no remedy for it, but that you will
needs buy and sell men and women like beasts, we
shall have all the world drink brown and white bastard.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: O heavens! what stuff is here

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: 'Twas never merry world since, of two usuries, the
merriest was put down, and the worser allowed by
order of law a furred gown to keep him warm; and
furred with fox and lamb-skins too, to signify, that
craft, being richer than innocency, stands for the facing.

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: Come your way, sir. 'Bless you, good father friar.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: And you, good brother father. What offence hath
this man made you, sir?

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: Marry, sir, he hath offended the law: and, sir, we
take him to be a thief too, sir; for we have found
upon him, sir, a strange picklock, which we have
sent to the deputy.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Fie, sirrah! a bawd, a wicked bawd!
The evil that thou causest to be done,
That is thy means to live. Do thou but think
What 'tis to cram a maw or clothe a back
From such a filthy vice: say to thyself,
From their abominable and beastly touches
I drink, I eat, array myself, and live.
Canst thou believe thy living is a life,
So stinkingly depending? Go mend, go mend.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Indeed, it does stink in some sort, sir; but yet,
sir, I would prove--

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Nay, if the devil have given thee proofs for sin,
Thou wilt prove his. Take him to prison, officer:
Correction and instruction must both work
Ere this rude beast will profit.

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: He must before the deputy, sir; he has given him
warning: the deputy cannot abide a whoremaster: if
he be a whoremonger, and comes before him, he were
as good go a mile on his errand.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: That we were all, as some would seem to be,
From our faults, as faults from seeming, free!

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: His neck will come to your waist,--a cord, sir.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: I spy comfort; I cry bail. Here's a gentleman and a
friend of mine.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: How now, noble Pompey! What, at the wheels of
Caesar? art thou led in triumph? What, is there
none of Pygmalion's images, newly made woman, to be
had now, for putting the hand in the pocket and
extracting it clutch'd? What reply, ha? What
sayest thou to this tune, matter and method? Is't
not drowned i' the last rain, ha? What sayest
thou, Trot? Is the world as it was, man? Which is
the way? Is it sad, and few words? or how? The
trick of it?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Still thus, and thus; still worse!

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: How doth my dear morsel, thy mistress? Procures she
still, ha?

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Troth, sir, she hath eaten up all her beef, and she
is herself in the tub.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Why, 'tis good; it is the right of it; it must be
so: ever your fresh whore and your powdered bawd:
an unshunned consequence; it must be so. Art going
to prison, Pompey?

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Yes, faith, sir.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Why, 'tis not amiss, Pompey. Farewell: go, say I
sent thee thither. For debt, Pompey? or how?

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: For being a bawd, for being a bawd.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Well, then, imprison him: if imprisonment be the
due of a bawd, why, 'tis his right: bawd is he
doubtless, and of antiquity too; bawd-born.
Farewell, good Pompey. Commend me to the prison,
Pompey: you will turn good husband now, Pompey; you
will keep the house.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: I hope, sir, your good worship will be my bail.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: No, indeed, will I not, Pompey; it is not the wear.
I will pray, Pompey, to increase your bondage: If
you take it not patiently, why, your mettle is the
more. Adieu, trusty Pompey. 'Bless you, friar.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: And you.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Does Bridget paint still, Pompey, ha?

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: Come your ways, sir; come.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: You will not bail me, then, sir?

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Then, Pompey, nor now. What news abroad, friar?
what news?

SPEAKER: ELBOW
LINE: Come your ways, sir; come.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Go to kennel, Pompey; go.
What news, friar, of the duke?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: I know none. Can you tell me of any?

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Some say he is with the Emperor of Russia; other
some, he is in Rome: but where is he, think you?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: I know not where; but wheresoever, I wish him well.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: It was a mad fantastical trick of him to steal from
the state, and usurp the beggary he was never born
to. Lord Angelo dukes it well in his absence; he
puts transgression to 't.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: He does well in 't.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: A little more lenity to lechery would do no harm in
him: something too crabbed that way, friar.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: It is too general a vice, and severity must cure it.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Yes, in good sooth, the vice is of a great kindred;
it is well allied: but it is impossible to extirp
it quite, friar, till eating and drinking be put
down. They say this Angelo was not made by man and
woman after this downright way of creation: is it
true, think you?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: How should he be made, then?

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Some report a sea-maid spawned him; some, that he
was begot between two stock-fishes. But it is
certain that when he makes water his urine is
congealed ice; that I know to be true: and he is a
motion generative; that's infallible.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: You are pleasant, sir, and speak apace.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Why, what a ruthless thing is this in him, for the
rebellion of a codpiece to take away the life of a
man! Would the duke that is absent have done this?
Ere he would have hanged a man for the getting a
hundred bastards, he would have paid for the nursing
a thousand: he had some feeling of the sport: he
knew the service, and that instructed him to mercy.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: I never heard the absent duke much detected for
women; he was not inclined that way.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: O, sir, you are deceived.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: 'Tis not possible.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Who, not the duke? yes, your beggar of fifty; and
his use was to put a ducat in her clack-dish: the
duke had crotchets in him. He would be drunk too;
that let me inform you.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: You do him wrong, surely.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Sir, I was an inward of his. A shy fellow was the
duke: and I believe I know the cause of his
withdrawing.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: What, I prithee, might be the cause?

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: No, pardon; 'tis a secret must be locked within the
teeth and the lips: but this I can let you
understand, the greater file of the subject held the
duke to be wise.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Wise! why, no question but he was.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: A very superficial, ignorant, unweighing fellow.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Either this is the envy in you, folly, or mistaking:
the very stream of his life and the business he hath
helmed must upon a warranted need give him a better
proclamation. Let him be but testimonied in his own
bringings-forth, and he shall appear to the
envious a scholar, a statesman and a soldier.
Therefore you speak unskilfully: or if your
knowledge be more it is much darkened in your malice.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Sir, I know him, and I love him.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Love talks with better knowledge, and knowledge with
dearer love.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Come, sir, I know what I know.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: I can hardly believe that, since you know not what
you speak. But, if ever the duke return, as our
prayers are he may, let me desire you to make your
answer before him. If it be honest you have spoke,
you have courage to maintain it: I am bound to call
upon you; and, I pray you, your name?

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Sir, my name is Lucio; well known to the duke.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: He shall know you better, sir, if I may live to
report you.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: I fear you not.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: O, you hope the duke will return no more; or you
imagine me too unhurtful an opposite. But indeed I
can do you little harm; you'll forswear this again.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: I'll be hanged first: thou art deceived in me,
friar. But no more of this. Canst thou tell if
Claudio die to-morrow or no?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Why should he die, sir?

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Why? For filling a bottle with a tundish. I would
the duke we talk of were returned again: the
ungenitured agent will unpeople the province with
continency; sparrows must not build in his
house-eaves, because they are lecherous. The duke
yet would have dark deeds darkly answered; he would
never bring them to light: would he were returned!
Marry, this Claudio is condemned for untrussing.
Farewell, good friar: I prithee, pray for me. The
duke, I say to thee again, would eat mutton on
Fridays. He's not past it yet, and I say to thee,
he would mouth with a beggar, though she smelt brown
bread and garlic: say that I said so. Farewell.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: No might nor greatness in mortality
Can censure 'scape; back-wounding calumny
The whitest virtue strikes. What king so strong
Can tie the gall up in the slanderous tongue?
But who comes here?

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Go; away with her to prison!

SPEAKER: MISTRESS OVERDONE
LINE: Good my lord, be good to me; your honour is accounted
a merciful man; good my lord.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Double and treble admonition, and still forfeit in
the same kind! This would make mercy swear and play
the tyrant.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: A bawd of eleven years' continuance, may it please
your honour.

SPEAKER: MISTRESS OVERDONE
LINE: My lord, this is one Lucio's information against me.
Mistress Kate Keepdown was with child by him in the
duke's time; he promised her marriage: his child
is a year and a quarter old, come Philip and Jacob:
I have kept it myself; and see how he goes about to abuse me!

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: That fellow is a fellow of much licence: let him be
called before us. Away with her to prison! Go to;
no more words.
Provost, my brother Angelo will not be altered;
Claudio must die to-morrow: let him be furnished
with divines, and have all charitable preparation.
if my brother wrought by my pity, it should not be
so with him.
