SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: So please you, this friar hath been with him, and
advised him for the entertainment of death.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Good even, good father.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Bliss and goodness on you!

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Of whence are you?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Not of this country, though my chance is now
To use it for my time: I am a brother
Of gracious order, late come from the See
In special business from his holiness.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: What news abroad i' the world?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: None, but that there is so great a fever on
goodness, that the dissolution of it must cure it:
novelty is only in request; and it is as dangerous
to be aged in any kind of course, as it is virtuous
to be constant in any undertaking. There is scarce
truth enough alive to make societies secure; but
security enough to make fellowships accurst: much
upon this riddle runs the wisdom of the world. This
news is old enough, yet it is every day's news. I
pray you, sir, of what disposition was the duke?

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: One that, above all other strifes, contended
especially to know himself.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: What pleasure was he given to?

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Rather rejoicing to see another merry, than merry at
any thing which professed to make him rejoice: a
gentleman of all temperance. But leave we him to
his events, with a prayer they may prove prosperous;
and let me desire to know how you find Claudio
prepared. I am made to understand that you have
lent him visitation.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: He professes to have received no sinister measure
from his judge, but most willingly humbles himself
to the determination of justice: yet had he framed
to himself, by the instruction of his frailty, many
deceiving promises of life; which I by my good
leisure have discredited to him, and now is he
resolved to die.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: You have paid the heavens your function, and the
prisoner the very debt of your calling. I have
laboured for the poor gentleman to the extremest
shore of my modesty: but my brother justice have I
found so severe, that he hath forced me to tell him
he is indeed Justice.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: If his own life answer the straitness of his
proceeding, it shall become him well; wherein if he
chance to fail, he hath sentenced himself.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: I am going to visit the prisoner. Fare you well.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Peace be with you!
He who the sword of heaven will bear
Should be as holy as severe;
Pattern in himself to know,
Grace to stand, and virtue go;
More nor less to others paying
Than by self-offences weighing.
Shame to him whose cruel striking
Kills for faults of his own liking!
Twice treble shame on Angelo,
To weed my vice and let his grow!
O, what may man within him hide,
Though angel on the outward side!
How may likeness made in crimes,
Making practise on the times,
To draw with idle spiders' strings
Most ponderous and substantial things!
Craft against vice I must apply:
With Angelo to-night shall lie
His old betrothed but despised;
So disguise shall, by the disguised,
Pay with falsehood false exacting,
And perform an old contracting.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I.  The moated grange at ST. LUKE's.

LINE: Take, O, take those lips away,
That so sweetly were forsworn;
And those eyes, the break of day,
Lights that do mislead the morn:
But my kisses bring again, bring again;
Seals of love, but sealed in vain, sealed in vain.

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: Break off thy song, and haste thee quick away:
Here comes a man of comfort, whose advice
Hath often still'd my brawling discontent.
I cry you mercy, sir; and well could wish
You had not found me here so musical:
Let me excuse me, and believe me so,
My mirth it much displeased, but pleased my woe.
STAGEDIR: Enter DUKE VINCENTIO disguised as before

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: 'Tis good; though music oft hath such a charm
To make bad good, and good provoke to harm.
I pray, you, tell me, hath any body inquired
for me here to-day? much upon this time have
I promised here to meet.

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: You have not been inquired after:
I have sat here all day.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: I do constantly believe you. The time is come even
now. I shall crave your forbearance a little: may
be I will call upon you anon, for some advantage to yourself.

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: I am always bound to you.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Very well met, and well come.
What is the news from this good deputy?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: He hath a garden circummured with brick,
Whose western side is with a vineyard back'd;
And to that vineyard is a planched gate,
That makes his opening with this bigger key:
This other doth command a little door
Which from the vineyard to the garden leads;
There have I made my promise
Upon the heavy middle of the night
To call upon him.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: But shall you on your knowledge find this way?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: I have ta'en a due and wary note upon't:
With whispering and most guilty diligence,
In action all of precept, he did show me
The way twice o'er.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Are there no other tokens
Between you 'greed concerning her observance?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: No, none, but only a repair i' the dark;
And that I have possess'd him my most stay
Can be but brief; for I have made him know
I have a servant comes with me along,
That stays upon me, whose persuasion is
I come about my brother.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: 'Tis well borne up.
I have not yet made known to Mariana
A word of this. What, ho! within! come forth!
I pray you, be acquainted with this maid;
She comes to do you good.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: I do desire the like.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Do you persuade yourself that I respect you?

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: Good friar, I know you do, and have found it.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Take, then, this your companion by the hand,
Who hath a story ready for your ear.
I shall attend your leisure: but make haste;
The vaporous night approaches.

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: Will't please you walk aside?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: O place and greatness! millions of false eyes
Are stuck upon thee: volumes of report
Run with these false and most contrarious quests
Upon thy doings: thousand escapes of wit
Make thee the father of their idle dreams
And rack thee in their fancies.
Welcome, how agreed?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: She'll take the enterprise upon her, father,
If you advise it.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: It is not my consent,
But my entreaty too.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Little have you to say
When you depart from him, but, soft and low,
'Remember now my brother.'

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: Fear me not.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Nor, gentle daughter, fear you not at all.
He is your husband on a pre-contract:
To bring you thus together, 'tis no sin,
Sith that the justice of your title to him
Doth flourish the deceit. Come, let us go:
Our corn's to reap, for yet our tithe's to sow.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II.  A room in the prison.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: Come hither, sirrah. Can you cut off a man's head?

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: If the man be a bachelor, sir, I can; but if he be a
married man, he's his wife's head, and I can never
cut off a woman's head.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: Come, sir, leave me your snatches, and yield me a
direct answer. To-morrow morning are to die Claudio
and Barnardine. Here is in our prison a common
executioner, who in his office lacks a helper: if
you will take it on you to assist him, it shall
redeem you from your gyves; if not, you shall have
your full time of imprisonment and your deliverance
with an unpitied whipping, for you have been a
notorious bawd.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Sir, I have been an unlawful bawd time out of mind;
but yet I will be content to be a lawful hangman. I
would be glad to receive some instruction from my
fellow partner.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: What, ho! Abhorson! Where's Abhorson, there?

SPEAKER: ABHORSON
LINE: Do you call, sir?

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: Sirrah, here's a fellow will help you to-morrow in
your execution. If you think it meet, compound with
him by the year, and let him abide here with you; if
not, use him for the present and dismiss him. He
cannot plead his estimation with you; he hath been a bawd.

SPEAKER: ABHORSON
LINE: A bawd, sir? fie upon him! he will discredit our mystery.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: Go to, sir; you weigh equally; a feather will turn
the scale.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Pray, sir, by your good favour,--for surely, sir, a
good favour you have, but that you have a hanging
look,--do you call, sir, your occupation a mystery?

SPEAKER: ABHORSON
LINE: Ay, sir; a mystery

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Painting, sir, I have heard say, is a mystery; and
your whores, sir, being members of my occupation,
using painting, do prove my occupation a mystery:
but what mystery there should be in hanging, if I
should be hanged, I cannot imagine.

SPEAKER: ABHORSON
LINE: Sir, it is a mystery.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Proof?

SPEAKER: ABHORSON
LINE: Every true man's apparel fits your thief: if it be
too little for your thief, your true man thinks it
big enough; if it be too big for your thief, your
thief thinks it little enough: so every true man's
apparel fits your thief.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: Are you agreed?

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Sir, I will serve him; for I do find your hangman is
a more penitent trade than your bawd; he doth
oftener ask forgiveness.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: You, sirrah, provide your block and your axe
to-morrow four o'clock.

SPEAKER: ABHORSON
LINE: Come on, bawd; I will instruct thee in my trade; follow.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: I do desire to learn, sir: and I hope, if you have
occasion to use me for your own turn, you shall find
me yare; for truly, sir, for your kindness I owe you
a good turn.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: Call hither Barnardine and Claudio:
The one has my pity; not a jot the other,
Being a murderer, though he were my brother.
Look, here's the warrant, Claudio, for thy death:
'Tis now dead midnight, and by eight to-morrow
Thou must be made immortal. Where's Barnardine?

SPEAKER: CLAUDIO
LINE: As fast lock'd up in sleep as guiltless labour
When it lies starkly in the traveller's bones:
He will not wake.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: Who can do good on him?
Well, go, prepare yourself.
But, hark, what noise?
Heaven give your spirits comfort!
By and by.
I hope it is some pardon or reprieve
For the most gentle Claudio.
Welcome father.
STAGEDIR: Enter DUKE VINCENTIO disguised as before

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: The best and wholesomest spirts of the night
Envelope you, good Provost! Who call'd here of late?

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: None, since the curfew rung.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Not Isabel?

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: No.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: They will, then, ere't be long.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: What comfort is for Claudio?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: There's some in hope.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: It is a bitter deputy.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Not so, not so; his life is parallel'd
Even with the stroke and line of his great justice:
He doth with holy abstinence subdue
That in himself which he spurs on his power
To qualify in others: were he meal'd with that
Which he corrects, then were he tyrannous;
But this being so, he's just.
Now are they come.
This is a gentle provost: seldom when
The steeled gaoler is the friend of men.
How now! what noise? That spirit's possessed with haste
That wounds the unsisting postern with these strokes.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: There he must stay until the officer
Arise to let him in: he is call'd up.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Have you no countermand for Claudio yet,
But he must die to-morrow?

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: None, sir, none.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: As near the dawning, provost, as it is,
You shall hear more ere morning.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: Happily
You something know; yet I believe there comes
No countermand; no such example have we:
Besides, upon the very siege of justice
Lord Angelo hath to the public ear
Profess'd the contrary.
This is his lordship's man.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: And here comes Claudio's pardon.

SPEAKER: Messenger
LINE: My lord hath sent you this note; and by me this
further charge, that you swerve not from the
smallest article of it, neither in time, matter, or
other circumstance. Good morrow; for, as I take it,
it is almost day.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: I shall obey him.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO

LINE.__text: This is his pardon, purchased by such sin

LINE: For which the pardoner himself is in.
Hence hath offence his quick celerity,
When it is born in high authority:
When vice makes mercy, mercy's so extended,
That for the fault's love is the offender friended.
Now, sir, what news?

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: I told you. Lord Angelo, belike thinking me remiss
in mine office, awakens me with this unwonted
putting-on; methinks strangely, for he hath not used it before.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Pray you, let's hear.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: 'Whatsoever you may hear to the contrary, let
Claudio be executed by four of the clock; and in the
afternoon Barnardine: for my better satisfaction,
let me have Claudio's head sent me by five. Let
this be duly performed; with a thought that more
depends on it than we must yet deliver. Thus fail
not to do your office, as you will answer it at your peril.'
What say you to this, sir?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: What is that Barnardine who is to be executed in the
afternoon?

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: A Bohemian born, but here nursed un and bred; one
that is a prisoner nine years old.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: How came it that the absent duke had not either
delivered him to his liberty or executed him? I
have heard it was ever his manner to do so.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: His friends still wrought reprieves for him: and,
indeed, his fact, till now in the government of Lord
Angelo, came not to an undoubtful proof.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: It is now apparent?

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: Most manifest, and not denied by himself.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Hath he born himself penitently in prison? how
seems he to be touched?

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: A man that apprehends death no more dreadfully but
as a drunken sleep; careless, reckless, and fearless
of what's past, present, or to come; insensible of
mortality, and desperately mortal.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: He wants advice.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: He will hear none: he hath evermore had the liberty
of the prison; give him leave to escape hence, he
would not: drunk many times a day, if not many days
entirely drunk. We have very oft awaked him, as if
to carry him to execution, and showed him a seeming
warrant for it: it hath not moved him at all.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: More of him anon. There is written in your brow,
provost, honesty and constancy: if I read it not
truly, my ancient skill beguiles me; but, in the
boldness of my cunning, I will lay myself in hazard.
Claudio, whom here you have warrant to execute, is
no greater forfeit to the law than Angelo who hath
sentenced him. To make you understand this in a
manifested effect, I crave but four days' respite;
for the which you are to do me both a present and a
dangerous courtesy.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: Pray, sir, in what?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: In the delaying death.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: A lack, how may I do it, having the hour limited,
and an express command, under penalty, to deliver
his head in the view of Angelo? I may make my case
as Claudio's, to cross this in the smallest.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: By the vow of mine order I warrant you, if my
instructions may be your guide. Let this Barnardine
be this morning executed, and his head born to Angelo.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: Angelo hath seen them both, and will discover the favour.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: O, death's a great disguiser; and you may add to it.
Shave the head, and tie the beard; and say it was
the desire of the penitent to be so bared before his
death: you know the course is common. If any thing
fall to you upon this, more than thanks and good
fortune, by the saint whom I profess, I will plead
against it with my life.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: Pardon me, good father; it is against my oath.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Were you sworn to the duke, or to the deputy?

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: To him, and to his substitutes.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: You will think you have made no offence, if the duke
avouch the justice of your dealing?

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: But what likelihood is in that?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Not a resemblance, but a certainty. Yet since I see
you fearful, that neither my coat, integrity, nor
persuasion can with ease attempt you, I will go
further than I meant, to pluck all fears out of you.
Look you, sir, here is the hand and seal of the
duke: you know the character, I doubt not; and the
signet is not strange to you.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: I know them both.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: The contents of this is the return of the duke: you
shall anon over-read it at your pleasure; where you
shall find, within these two days he will be here.
This is a thing that Angelo knows not; for he this
very day receives letters of strange tenor;
perchance of the duke's death; perchance entering
into some monastery; but, by chance, nothing of what
is writ. Look, the unfolding star calls up the
shepherd. Put not yourself into amazement how these
things should be: all difficulties are but easy
when they are known. Call your executioner, and off
with Barnardine's head: I will give him a present
shrift and advise him for a better place. Yet you
are amazed; but this shall absolutely resolve you.
Come away; it is almost clear dawn.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III.  Another room in the same.
STAGEDIR: Enter DUKE VINCENTIO disguised as before

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: I am as well acquainted here as I was in our house
of profession: one would think it were Mistress
Overdone's own house, for here be many of her old
customers. First, here's young Master Rash; he's in
for a commodity of brown paper and old ginger,
ninescore and seventeen pounds; of which he made
five marks, ready money: marry, then ginger was not
much in request, for the old women were all dead.
Then is there here one Master Caper, at the suit of
Master Three-pile the mercer, for some four suits of
peach-coloured satin, which now peaches him a
beggar. Then have we here young Dizy, and young
Master Deep-vow, and Master Copperspur, and Master
Starve-lackey the rapier and dagger man, and young
Drop-heir that killed lusty Pudding, and Master
Forthlight the tilter, and brave Master Shooty the
great traveller, and wild Half-can that stabbed
Pots, and, I think, forty more; all great doers in
our trade, and are now 'for the Lord's sake.'

SPEAKER: ABHORSON
LINE: Sirrah, bring Barnardine hither.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Master Barnardine! you must rise and be hanged.
Master Barnardine!

SPEAKER: ABHORSON
LINE: What, ho, Barnardine!

SPEAKER: BARNARDINE

LINE.__text: A pox o' your throats! Who makes that

LINE: noise there? What are you?

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Your friends, sir; the hangman. You must be so
good, sir, to rise and be put to death.

LINE.__text: Away, you rogue, away! I am sleepy.

SPEAKER: ABHORSON
LINE: Tell him he must awake, and that quickly too.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Pray, Master Barnardine, awake till you are
executed, and sleep afterwards.

SPEAKER: ABHORSON
LINE: Go in to him, and fetch him out.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: He is coming, sir, he is coming; I hear his straw rustle.

SPEAKER: ABHORSON
LINE: Is the axe upon the block, sirrah?

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: Very ready, sir.

SPEAKER: BARNARDINE
LINE: How now, Abhorson? what's the news with you?

SPEAKER: ABHORSON
LINE: Truly, sir, I would desire you to clap into your
prayers; for, look you, the warrant's come.

SPEAKER: BARNARDINE
LINE: You rogue, I have been drinking all night; I am not
fitted for 't.

SPEAKER: POMPEY
LINE: O, the better, sir; for he that drinks all night,
and is hanged betimes in the morning, may sleep the
sounder all the next day.

SPEAKER: ABHORSON
LINE: Look you, sir; here comes your ghostly father: do
we jest now, think you?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Sir, induced by my charity, and hearing how hastily
you are to depart, I am come to advise you, comfort
you and pray with you.

SPEAKER: BARNARDINE
LINE: Friar, not I I have been drinking hard all night,
and I will have more time to prepare me, or they
shall beat out my brains with billets: I will not
consent to die this day, that's certain.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: O, sir, you must: and therefore I beseech you
Look forward on the journey you shall go.

SPEAKER: BARNARDINE
LINE: I swear I will not die to-day for any man's
persuasion.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: But hear you.

SPEAKER: BARNARDINE
LINE: Not a word: if you have any thing to say to me,
come to my ward; for thence will not I to-day.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Unfit to live or die: O gravel heart!
After him, fellows; bring him to the block.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: Now, sir, how do you find the prisoner?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: A creature unprepared, unmeet for death;
And to transport him in the mind he is
Were damnable.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: Here in the prison, father,
There died this morning of a cruel fever
One Ragozine, a most notorious pirate,
A man of Claudio's years; his beard and head
Just of his colour. What if we do omit
This reprobate till he were well inclined;
And satisfy the deputy with the visage
Of Ragozine, more like to Claudio?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: O, 'tis an accident that heaven provides!
Dispatch it presently; the hour draws on
Prefix'd by Angelo: see this be done,
And sent according to command; whiles I
Persuade this rude wretch willingly to die.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: This shall be done, good father, presently.
But Barnardine must die this afternoon:
And how shall we continue Claudio,
To save me from the danger that might come
If he were known alive?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Let this be done.
Put them in secret holds, both Barnardine and Claudio:
Ere twice the sun hath made his journal greeting
To the under generation, you shall find
Your safety manifested.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: I am your free dependant.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Quick, dispatch, and send the head to Angelo.
Now will I write letters to Angelo,--
The provost, he shall bear them, whose contents
Shall witness to him I am near at home,
And that, by great injunctions, I am bound
To enter publicly: him I'll desire
To meet me at the consecrated fount
A league below the city; and from thence,
By cold gradation and well-balanced form,
We shall proceed with Angelo.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: Here is the head; I'll carry it myself.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Convenient is it. Make a swift return;
For I would commune with you of such things
That want no ear but yours.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: I'll make all speed.

LINE.__text: Peace, ho, be here!

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: The tongue of Isabel. She's come to know
If yet her brother's pardon be come hither:
But I will keep her ignorant of her good,
To make her heavenly comforts of despair,
When it is least expected.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Ho, by your leave!

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Good morning to you, fair and gracious daughter.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: The better, given me by so holy a man.
Hath yet the deputy sent my brother's pardon?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: He hath released him, Isabel, from the world:
His head is off and sent to Angelo.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Nay, but it is not so.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: It is no other: show your wisdom, daughter,
In your close patience.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: O, I will to him and pluck out his eyes!

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: You shall not be admitted to his sight.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Unhappy Claudio! wretched Isabel!
Injurious world! most damned Angelo!

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: This nor hurts him nor profits you a jot;
Forbear it therefore; give your cause to heaven.
Mark what I say, which you shall find
By every syllable a faithful verity:
The duke comes home to-morrow; nay, dry your eyes;
One of our convent, and his confessor,
Gives me this instance: already he hath carried
Notice to Escalus and Angelo,
Who do prepare to meet him at the gates,
There to give up their power. If you can, pace your wisdom
In that good path that I would wish it go,
And you shall have your bosom on this wretch,
Grace of the duke, revenges to your heart,
And general honour.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: I am directed by you.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: This letter, then, to Friar Peter give;
'Tis that he sent me of the duke's return:
Say, by this token, I desire his company
At Mariana's house to-night. Her cause and yours
I'll perfect him withal, and he shall bring you
Before the duke, and to the head of Angelo
Accuse him home and home. For my poor self,
I am combined by a sacred vow
And shall be absent. Wend you with this letter:
Command these fretting waters from your eyes
With a light heart; trust not my holy order,
If I pervert your course. Who's here?

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Good even. Friar, where's the provost?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Not within, sir.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: O pretty Isabella, I am pale at mine heart to see
thine eyes so red: thou must be patient. I am fain
to dine and sup with water and bran; I dare not for
my head fill my belly; one fruitful meal would set
me to 't. But they say the duke will be here
to-morrow. By my troth, Isabel, I loved thy brother:
if the old fantastical duke of dark corners had been
at home, he had lived.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Sir, the duke is marvellous little beholding to your
reports; but the best is, he lives not in them.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Friar, thou knowest not the duke so well as I do:
he's a better woodman than thou takest him for.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Well, you'll answer this one day. Fare ye well.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Nay, tarry; I'll go along with thee
I can tell thee pretty tales of the duke.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: You have told me too many of him already, sir, if
they be true; if not true, none were enough.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: I was once before him for getting a wench with child.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Did you such a thing?

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Yes, marry, did I but I was fain to forswear it;
they would else have married me to the rotten medlar.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Sir, your company is fairer than honest. Rest you well.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: By my troth, I'll go with thee to the lane's end:
if bawdy talk offend you, we'll have very little of
it. Nay, friar, I am a kind of burr; I shall stick.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV.  A room in ANGELO's house.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Every letter he hath writ hath disvouched other.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: In most uneven and distracted manner. His actions
show much like to madness: pray heaven his wisdom be
not tainted! And why meet him at the gates, and
redeliver our authorities there

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: I guess not.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: And why should we proclaim it in an hour before his
entering, that if any crave redress of injustice,
they should exhibit their petitions in the street?

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: He shows his reason for that: to have a dispatch of
complaints, and to deliver us from devices
hereafter, which shall then have no power to stand
against us.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Well, I beseech you, let it be proclaimed betimes
i' the morn; I'll call you at your house: give
notice to such men of sort and suit as are to meet
him.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: I shall, sir. Fare you well.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Good night.
This deed unshapes me quite, makes me unpregnant
And dull to all proceedings. A deflower'd maid!
And by an eminent body that enforced
The law against it! But that her tender shame
Will not proclaim against her maiden loss,
How might she tongue me! Yet reason dares her no;
For my authority bears of a credent bulk,
That no particular scandal once can touch
But it confounds the breather. He should have lived,
Save that riotous youth, with dangerous sense,
Might in the times to come have ta'en revenge,
By so receiving a dishonour'd life
With ransom of such shame. Would yet he had lived!
A lack, when once our grace we have forgot,
Nothing goes right: we would, and we would not.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE V.  Fields without the town.
STAGEDIR: Enter DUKE VINCENTIO in his own habit, and FRIAR PETER

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: These letters at fit time deliver me
The provost knows our purpose and our plot.
The matter being afoot, keep your instruction,
And hold you ever to our special drift;
Though sometimes you do blench from this to that,
As cause doth minister. Go call at Flavius' house,
And tell him where I stay: give the like notice
To Valentinus, Rowland, and to Crassus,
And bid them bring the trumpets to the gate;
But send me Flavius first.

SPEAKER: FRIAR PETER
LINE: It shall be speeded well.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: I thank thee, Varrius; thou hast made good haste:
Come, we will walk. There's other of our friends
Will greet us here anon, my gentle Varrius.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VI.  Street near the city gate.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: To speak so indirectly I am loath:
I would say the truth; but to accuse him so,
That is your part: yet I am advised to do it;
He says, to veil full purpose.

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: Be ruled by him.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Besides, he tells me that, if peradventure
He speak against me on the adverse side,
I should not think it strange; for 'tis a physic
That's bitter to sweet end.

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: I would Friar Peter--

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: O, peace! the friar is come.

SPEAKER: FRIAR PETER
LINE: Come, I have found you out a stand most fit,
Where you may have such vantage on the duke,
He shall not pass you. Twice have the trumpets sounded;
The generous and gravest citizens
Have hent the gates, and very near upon
The duke is entering: therefore, hence, away!

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I.  The city gate.
STAGEDIR:
MARIANA veiled, ISABELLA, and FRIAR PETER, at their
stand. Enter DUKE VINCENTIO, VARRIUS, Lords,
ANGELO, ESCALUS, LUCIO, Provost, Officers, and
Citizens, at several doors
FRIAR PETER and ISABELLA come forward

Re-enter Officers with ISABELLA; and Provost with
the DUKE VINCENTIO in his friar's habit

Pulls off the friar's hood, and discovers DUKE
VINCENTIO
Exeunt ANGELO, MARIANA, FRIAR PETER and Provost
Re-enter ANGELO, MARIANA, FRIAR PETER, and Provost

Re-enter Provost, with BARNARDINE, CLAUDIO muffled,
and JULIET

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: My very worthy cousin, fairly met!
Our old and faithful friend, we are glad to see you.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
ESCALUS
LINE: Happy return be to your royal grace!

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Many and hearty thankings to you both.
We have made inquiry of you; and we hear
Such goodness of your justice, that our soul
Cannot but yield you forth to public thanks,
Forerunning more requital.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: You make my bonds still greater.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: O, your desert speaks loud; and I should wrong it,
To lock it in the wards of covert bosom,
When it deserves, with characters of brass,
A forted residence 'gainst the tooth of time
And razure of oblivion. Give me your hand,
And let the subject see, to make them know
That outward courtesies would fain proclaim
Favours that keep within. Come, Escalus,
You must walk by us on our other hand;
And good supporters are you.

SPEAKER: FRIAR PETER
LINE: Now is your time: speak loud and kneel before him.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Justice, O royal duke! Vail your regard
Upon a wrong'd, I would fain have said, a maid!
O worthy prince, dishonour not your eye
By throwing it on any other object
Till you have heard me in my true complaint
And given me justice, justice, justice, justice!

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Relate your wrongs; in what? by whom? be brief.
Here is Lord Angelo shall give you justice:
Reveal yourself to him.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: O worthy duke,
You bid me seek redemption of the devil:
Hear me yourself; for that which I must speak
Must either punish me, not being believed,
Or wring redress from you. Hear me, O hear me, here!

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: My lord, her wits, I fear me, are not firm:
She hath been a suitor to me for her brother
Cut off by course of justice,--

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: By course of justice!

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: And she will speak most bitterly and strange.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Most strange, but yet most truly, will I speak:
That Angelo's forsworn; is it not strange?
That Angelo's a murderer; is 't not strange?
That Angelo is an adulterous thief,
An hypocrite, a virgin-violator;
Is it not strange and strange?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Nay, it is ten times strange.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: It is not truer he is Angelo
Than this is all as true as it is strange:
Nay, it is ten times true; for truth is truth
To the end of reckoning.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Away with her! Poor soul,
She speaks this in the infirmity of sense.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: O prince, I conjure thee, as thou believest
There is another comfort than this world,
That thou neglect me not, with that opinion
That I am touch'd with madness! Make not impossible
That which but seems unlike: 'tis not impossible
But one, the wicked'st caitiff on the ground,
May seem as shy, as grave, as just, as absolute
As Angelo; even so may Angelo,
In all his dressings, characts, titles, forms,
Be an arch-villain; believe it, royal prince:
If he be less, he's nothing; but he's more,
Had I more name for badness.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: By mine honesty,
If she be mad,--as I believe no other,--
Her madness hath the oddest frame of sense,
Such a dependency of thing on thing,
As e'er I heard in madness.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: O gracious duke,
Harp not on that, nor do not banish reason
For inequality; but let your reason serve
To make the truth appear where it seems hid,
And hide the false seems true.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Many that are not mad
Have, sure, more lack of reason. What would you say?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: I am the sister of one Claudio,
Condemn'd upon the act of fornication
To lose his head; condemn'd by Angelo:
I, in probation of a sisterhood,
Was sent to by my brother; one Lucio
As then the messenger,--

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: That's I, an't like your grace:
I came to her from Claudio, and desired her
To try her gracious fortune with Lord Angelo
For her poor brother's pardon.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: That's he indeed.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: You were not bid to speak.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: No, my good lord;
Nor wish'd to hold my peace.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: I wish you now, then;
Pray you, take note of it: and when you have
A business for yourself, pray heaven you then
Be perfect.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: I warrant your honour.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: The warrants for yourself; take heed to't.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: This gentleman told somewhat of my tale,--

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Right.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: It may be right; but you are i' the wrong
To speak before your time. Proceed.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: I went
To this pernicious caitiff deputy,--

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: That's somewhat madly spoken.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Pardon it;
The phrase is to the matter.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Mended again. The matter; proceed.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: In brief, to set the needless process by,
How I persuaded, how I pray'd, and kneel'd,
How he refell'd me, and how I replied,--
For this was of much length,--the vile conclusion
I now begin with grief and shame to utter:
He would not, but by gift of my chaste body
To his concupiscible intemperate lust,
Release my brother; and, after much debatement,
My sisterly remorse confutes mine honour,
And I did yield to him: but the next morn betimes,
His purpose surfeiting, he sends a warrant
For my poor brother's head.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: This is most likely!

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: O, that it were as like as it is true!

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: By heaven, fond wretch, thou knowist not what thou speak'st,
Or else thou art suborn'd against his honour
In hateful practise. First, his integrity
Stands without blemish. Next, it imports no reason
That with such vehemency he should pursue
Faults proper to himself: if he had so offended,
He would have weigh'd thy brother by himself
And not have cut him off. Some one hath set you on:
Confess the truth, and say by whose advice
Thou camest here to complain.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: And is this all?
Then, O you blessed ministers above,
Keep me in patience, and with ripen'd time
Unfold the evil which is here wrapt up
In countenance! Heaven shield your grace from woe,
As I, thus wrong'd, hence unbelieved go!

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: I know you'ld fain be gone. An officer!
To prison with her! Shall we thus permit
A blasting and a scandalous breath to fall
On him so near us? This needs must be a practise.
Who knew of Your intent and coming hither?

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: One that I would were here, Friar Lodowick.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: A ghostly father, belike. Who knows that Lodowick?

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: My lord, I know him; 'tis a meddling friar;
I do not like the man: had he been lay, my lord
For certain words he spake against your grace
In your retirement, I had swinged him soundly.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Words against me? this is a good friar, belike!
And to set on this wretched woman here
Against our substitute! Let this friar be found.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: But yesternight, my lord, she and that friar,
I saw them at the prison: a saucy friar,
A very scurvy fellow.

SPEAKER: FRIAR PETER
LINE: Blessed be your royal grace!
I have stood by, my lord, and I have heard
Your royal ear abused. First, hath this woman
Most wrongfully accused your substitute,
Who is as free from touch or soil with her
As she from one ungot.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: We did believe no less.
Know you that Friar Lodowick that she speaks of?

SPEAKER: FRIAR PETER
LINE: I know him for a man divine and holy;
Not scurvy, nor a temporary meddler,
As he's reported by this gentleman;
And, on my trust, a man that never yet
Did, as he vouches, misreport your grace.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: My lord, most villanously; believe it.

SPEAKER: FRIAR PETER
LINE: Well, he in time may come to clear himself;
But at this instant he is sick my lord,
Of a strange fever. Upon his mere request,
Being come to knowledge that there was complaint
Intended 'gainst Lord Angelo, came I hither,
To speak, as from his mouth, what he doth know
Is true and false; and what he with his oath
And all probation will make up full clear,
Whensoever he's convented. First, for this woman.
To justify this worthy nobleman,
So vulgarly and personally accused,
Her shall you hear disproved to her eyes,
Till she herself confess it.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Good friar, let's hear it.
Do you not smile at this, Lord Angelo?
O heaven, the vanity of wretched fools!
Give us some seats. Come, cousin Angelo;
In this I'll be impartial; be you judge
Of your own cause. Is this the witness, friar?
First, let her show her face, and after speak.
STAGEDIR: ISABELLA is carried off guarded; and MARIANA comes forward

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: Pardon, my lord; I will not show my face
Until my husband bid me.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: What, are you married?

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: No, my lord.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Are you a maid?

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: No, my lord.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: A widow, then?

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: Neither, my lord.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Why, you are nothing then: neither maid, widow, nor wife?

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: My lord, she may be a punk; for many of them are
neither maid, widow, nor wife.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Silence that fellow: I would he had some cause
To prattle for himself.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Well, my lord.

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: My lord; I do confess I ne'er was married;
And I confess besides I am no maid:
I have known my husband; yet my husband
Knows not that ever he knew me.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: He was drunk then, my lord: it can be no better.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: For the benefit of silence, would thou wert so too!

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Well, my lord.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: This is no witness for Lord Angelo.

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: Now I come to't my lord
She that accuses him of fornication,
In self-same manner doth accuse my husband,
And charges him my lord, with such a time
When I'll depose I had him in mine arms
With all the effect of love.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Charges she more than me?

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: Not that I know.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: No? you say your husband.

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: Why, just, my lord, and that is Angelo,
Who thinks he knows that he ne'er knew my body,
But knows he thinks that he knows Isabel's.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: This is a strange abuse. Let's see thy face.

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: My husband bids me; now I will unmask.
This is that face, thou cruel Angelo,
Which once thou sworest was worth the looking on;
This is the hand which, with a vow'd contract,
Was fast belock'd in thine; this is the body
That took away the match from Isabel,
And did supply thee at thy garden-house
In her imagined person.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Know you this woman?

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Carnally, she says.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Sirrah, no more!

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Enough, my lord.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: My lord, I must confess I know this woman:
And five years since there was some speech of marriage
Betwixt myself and her; which was broke off,
Partly for that her promised proportions
Came short of composition, but in chief
For that her reputation was disvalued
In levity: since which time of five years
I never spake with her, saw her, nor heard from her,
Upon my faith and honour.

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: Noble prince,
As there comes light from heaven and words from breath,
As there is sense in truth and truth in virtue,
I am affianced this man's wife as strongly
As words could make up vows: and, my good lord,
But Tuesday night last gone in's garden-house
He knew me as a wife. As this is true,
Let me in safety raise me from my knees
Or else for ever be confixed here,
A marble monument!

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: I did but smile till now:
Now, good my lord, give me the scope of justice
My patience here is touch'd. I do perceive
These poor informal women are no more
But instruments of some more mightier member
That sets them on: let me have way, my lord,
To find this practise out.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Ay, with my heart
And punish them to your height of pleasure.
Thou foolish friar, and thou pernicious woman,
Compact with her that's gone, think'st thou thy oaths,
Though they would swear down each particular saint,
Were testimonies against his worth and credit
That's seal'd in approbation? You, Lord Escalus,
Sit with my cousin; lend him your kind pains
To find out this abuse, whence 'tis derived.
There is another friar that set them on;
Let him be sent for.

SPEAKER: FRIAR PETER
LINE: Would he were here, my lord! for he indeed
Hath set the women on to this complaint:
Your provost knows the place where he abides
And he may fetch him.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Go do it instantly.
And you, my noble and well-warranted cousin,
Whom it concerns to hear this matter forth,
Do with your injuries as seems you best,
In any chastisement: I for a while will leave you;
But stir not you till you have well determined
Upon these slanderers.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: My lord, we'll do it throughly.
Signior Lucio, did not you say you knew that
Friar Lodowick to be a dishonest person?

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: 'Cucullus non facit monachum:' honest in nothing
but in his clothes; and one that hath spoke most
villanous speeches of the duke.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: We shall entreat you to abide here till he come and
enforce them against him: we shall find this friar a
notable fellow.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: As any in Vienna, on my word.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Call that same Isabel here once again; I would speak with her.
Pray you, my lord, give me leave to question; you
shall see how I'll handle her.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Not better than he, by her own report.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Say you?

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Marry, sir, I think, if you handled her privately,
she would sooner confess: perchance, publicly,
she'll be ashamed.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: I will go darkly to work with her.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: That's the way; for women are light at midnight.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Come on, mistress: here's a gentlewoman denies all
that you have said.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: My lord, here comes the rascal I spoke of; here with
the provost.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: In very good time: speak not you to him till we
call upon you.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Mum.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Come, sir: did you set these women on to slander
Lord Angelo? they have confessed you did.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: 'Tis false.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: How! know you where you are?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Respect to your great place! and let the devil
Be sometime honour'd for his burning throne!
Where is the duke? 'tis he should hear me speak.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: The duke's in us; and we will hear you speak:
Look you speak justly.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Boldly, at least. But, O, poor souls,
Come you to seek the lamb here of the fox?
Good night to your redress! Is the duke gone?
Then is your cause gone too. The duke's unjust,
Thus to retort your manifest appeal,
And put your trial in the villain's mouth
Which here you come to accuse.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: This is the rascal; this is he I spoke of.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Why, thou unreverend and unhallow'd friar,
Is't not enough thou hast suborn'd these women
To accuse this worthy man, but, in foul mouth
And in the witness of his proper ear,
To call him villain? and then to glance from him
To the duke himself, to tax him with injustice?
Take him hence; to the rack with him! We'll touse you
Joint by joint, but we will know his purpose.
What 'unjust'!

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Be not so hot; the duke
Dare no more stretch this finger of mine than he
Dare rack his own: his subject am I not,
Nor here provincial. My business in this state
Made me a looker on here in Vienna,
Where I have seen corruption boil and bubble
Till it o'er-run the stew; laws for all faults,
But faults so countenanced, that the strong statutes
Stand like the forfeits in a barber's shop,
As much in mock as mark.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Slander to the state! Away with him to prison!

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: What can you vouch against him, Signior Lucio?
Is this the man that you did tell us of?

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: 'Tis he, my lord. Come hither, goodman baldpate:
do you know me?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: I remember you, sir, by the sound of your voice: I
met you at the prison, in the absence of the duke.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: O, did you so? And do you remember what you said of the duke?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Most notedly, sir.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Do you so, sir? And was the duke a fleshmonger, a
fool, and a coward, as you then reported him to be?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: You must, sir, change persons with me, ere you make
that my report: you, indeed, spoke so of him; and
much more, much worse.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: O thou damnable fellow! Did not I pluck thee by the
nose for thy speeches?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: I protest I love the duke as I love myself.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: Hark, how the villain would close now, after his
treasonable abuses!

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: Such a fellow is not to be talked withal. Away with
him to prison! Where is the provost? Away with him
to prison! lay bolts enough upon him: let him
speak no more. Away with those giglots too, and
with the other confederate companion!

LINE.__text: Stay, sir; stay awhile.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: What, resists he? Help him, Lucio.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Come, sir; come, sir; come, sir; foh, sir! Why, you
bald-pated, lying rascal, you must be hooded, must
you? Show your knave's visage, with a pox to you!
show your sheep-biting face, and be hanged an hour!
Will't not off?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Thou art the first knave that e'er madest a duke.
First, provost, let me bail these gentle three.
Sneak not away, sir; for the friar and you
Must have a word anon. Lay hold on him.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: This may prove worse than hanging.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO

LINE.__text: What you have spoke I pardon: sit you down:

LINE: We'll borrow place of him.
Sir, by your leave.
Hast thou or word, or wit, or impudence,
That yet can do thee office? If thou hast,
Rely upon it till my tale be heard,
And hold no longer out.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: O my dread lord,
I should be guiltier than my guiltiness,
To think I can be undiscernible,
When I perceive your grace, like power divine,
Hath look'd upon my passes. Then, good prince,
No longer session hold upon my shame,
But let my trial be mine own confession:
Immediate sentence then and sequent death
Is all the grace I beg.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Come hither, Mariana.
Say, wast thou e'er contracted to this woman?

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: I was, my lord.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Go take her hence, and marry her instantly.
Do you the office, friar; which consummate,
Return him here again. Go with him, provost.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: My lord, I am more amazed at his dishonour
Than at the strangeness of it.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Come hither, Isabel.
Your friar is now your prince: as I was then
Advertising and holy to your business,
Not changing heart with habit, I am still
Attorney'd at your service.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: O, give me pardon,
That I, your vassal, have employ'd and pain'd
Your unknown sovereignty!

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: You are pardon'd, Isabel:
And now, dear maid, be you as free to us.
Your brother's death, I know, sits at your heart;
And you may marvel why I obscured myself,
Labouring to save his life, and would not rather
Make rash remonstrance of my hidden power
Than let him so be lost. O most kind maid,
It was the swift celerity of his death,
Which I did think with slower foot came on,
That brain'd my purpose. But, peace be with him!
That life is better life, past fearing death,
Than that which lives to fear: make it your comfort,
So happy is your brother.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: I do, my lord.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: For this new-married man approaching here,
Whose salt imagination yet hath wrong'd
Your well defended honour, you must pardon
For Mariana's sake: but as he adjudged your brother,--
Being criminal, in double violation
Of sacred chastity and of promise-breach
Thereon dependent, for your brother's life,--
The very mercy of the law cries out
Most audible, even from his proper tongue,
'An Angelo for Claudio, death for death!'
Haste still pays haste, and leisure answers leisure;
Like doth quit like, and MEASURE still FOR MEASURE.
Then, Angelo, thy fault's thus manifested;
Which, though thou wouldst deny, denies thee vantage.
We do condemn thee to the very block
Where Claudio stoop'd to death, and with like haste.
Away with him!

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: O my most gracious lord,
I hope you will not mock me with a husband.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: It is your husband mock'd you with a husband.
Consenting to the safeguard of your honour,
I thought your marriage fit; else imputation,
For that he knew you, might reproach your life
And choke your good to come; for his possessions,
Although by confiscation they are ours,
We do instate and widow you withal,
To buy you a better husband.

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: O my dear lord,
I crave no other, nor no better man.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Never crave him; we are definitive.

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: Gentle my liege,--

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: You do but lose your labour.
Away with him to death!
Now, sir, to you.

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: O my good lord! Sweet Isabel, take my part;
Lend me your knees, and all my life to come
I'll lend you all my life to do you service.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Against all sense you do importune her:
Should she kneel down in mercy of this fact,
Her brother's ghost his paved bed would break,
And take her hence in horror.

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: Isabel,
Sweet Isabel, do yet but kneel by me;
Hold up your hands, say nothing; I'll speak all.
They say, best men are moulded out of faults;
And, for the most, become much more the better
For being a little bad: so may my husband.
O Isabel, will you not lend a knee?

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: He dies for Claudio's death.

SPEAKER: ISABELLA
LINE: Most bounteous sir,
Look, if it please you, on this man condemn'd,
As if my brother lived: I partly think
A due sincerity govern'd his deeds,
Till he did look on me: since it is so,
Let him not die. My brother had but justice,
In that he did the thing for which he died:
For Angelo,
His act did not o'ertake his bad intent,
And must be buried but as an intent
That perish'd by the way: thoughts are no subjects;
Intents but merely thoughts.

SPEAKER: MARIANA
LINE: Merely, my lord.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Your suit's unprofitable; stand up, I say.
I have bethought me of another fault.
Provost, how came it Claudio was beheaded
At an unusual hour?

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: It was commanded so.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Had you a special warrant for the deed?

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: No, my good lord; it was by private message.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: For which I do discharge you of your office:
Give up your keys.

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: Pardon me, noble lord:
I thought it was a fault, but knew it not;
Yet did repent me, after more advice;
For testimony whereof, one in the prison,
That should by private order else have died,
I have reserved alive.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: What's he?

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: His name is Barnardine.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: I would thou hadst done so by Claudio.
Go fetch him hither; let me look upon him.

SPEAKER: ESCALUS
LINE: I am sorry, one so learned and so wise
As you, Lord Angelo, have still appear'd,
Should slip so grossly, both in the heat of blood.
And lack of temper'd judgment afterward.

SPEAKER: ANGELO
LINE: I am sorry that such sorrow I procure:
And so deep sticks it in my penitent heart
That I crave death more willingly than mercy;
'Tis my deserving, and I do entreat it.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Which is that Barnardine?

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: This, my lord.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: There was a friar told me of this man.
Sirrah, thou art said to have a stubborn soul.
That apprehends no further than this world,
And squarest thy life according. Thou'rt condemn'd:
But, for those earthly faults, I quit them all;
And pray thee take this mercy to provide
For better times to come. Friar, advise him;
I leave him to your hand. What muffled fellow's that?

SPEAKER: Provost
LINE: This is another prisoner that I saved.
Who should have died when Claudio lost his head;
As like almost to Claudio as himself.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO

LINE.__text: If he be like your brother, for his sake

LINE: Is he pardon'd; and, for your lovely sake,
Give me your hand and say you will be mine.
He is my brother too: but fitter time for that.
By this Lord Angelo perceives he's safe;
Methinks I see a quickening in his eye.
Well, Angelo, your evil quits you well:
Look that you love your wife; her worth worth yours.
I find an apt remission in myself;
And yet here's one in place I cannot pardon.
You, sirrah, that knew me for a fool, a coward,
One all of luxury, an ass, a madman;
Wherein have I so deserved of you,
That you extol me thus?

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: 'Faith, my lord. I spoke it but according to the
trick. If you will hang me for it, you may; but I
had rather it would please you I might be whipt.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Whipt first, sir, and hanged after.
Proclaim it, provost, round about the city.
Is any woman wrong'd by this lewd fellow,
As I have heard him swear himself there's one
Whom he begot with child, let her appear,
And he shall marry her: the nuptial finish'd,
Let him be whipt and hang'd.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: I beseech your highness, do not marry me to a whore.
Your highness said even now, I made you a duke:
good my lord, do not recompense me in making me a cuckold.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Upon mine honour, thou shalt marry her.
Thy slanders I forgive; and therewithal
Remit thy other forfeits. Take him to prison;
And see our pleasure herein executed.

SPEAKER: LUCIO
LINE: Marrying a punk, my lord, is pressing to death,
whipping, and hanging.

SPEAKER: DUKE VINCENTIO
LINE: Slandering a prince deserves it.
She, Claudio, that you wrong'd, look you restore.
Joy to you, Mariana! Love her, Angelo:
I have confess'd her and I know her virtue.
Thanks, good friend Escalus, for thy much goodness:
There's more behind that is more gratulate.
Thanks, provost, for thy care and secrecy:
We shill employ thee in a worthier place.
Forgive him, Angelo, that brought you home
The head of Ragozine for Claudio's:
The offence pardons itself. Dear Isabel,
I have a motion much imports your good;
Whereto if you'll a willing ear incline,
What's mine is yours and what is yours is mine.
So, bring us to our palace; where we'll show
What's yet behind, that's meet you all should know.
